boardgame.name: Bold Brigands of the Belt (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They’re bold, they’re brigands, and they are in the Belt!

Bold Brigands of the Belt (5e) is a Rocket Age (5e) adventure for characters levels 2-4, preferably those with a rocket ship, although one can be provided by a patron for the adventure. Rocket ships are being stolen across the Solar System, some taken in deep space, others brazenly (some would say boldly) stolen from rocket ports ranging from Venus to Jupiter. Someone has to stop them, and maybe figure out who these Bold Brigands are and why they are stealing so many ships.

Spoiler alert, that someone is you. Travel to the Red Quadrant of the Asteroid Belt, explore the shifting maze of space rocks, and face the Bold Brigands of the Belt on their home turf in this pulse pounding adventure by Ed Greenwood!

boardgame.name: Little Grey Aliens 5e
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Little Grey Aliens 5e brings these strange visitors to your campaign with:

The Greys as a playable race with stats, culture, history, and how to integrate them into your game.
Five new backgrounds for the Command, Engineering, Medical, Science and Security departments.
New class archetypes such as the Commando, Psychic, and Technomacer.
The strange advanced technology of the Greys, wield a disk beamer, protect yourself with a phase induced field generator, heal with the autodoc, or use the apps on your datapad.
A hundred entry trinket table suitable to Little Grey Aliens 5e and other sci-fi or science fantasy games.

boardgame.name: Toerkk
boardgame.description:
Toerkk is a fast paced fantasy card game with innovative mechanics for 2 to 4 players. Play as one of the dwarven warlords and win the game either by digging out 20 levels of ground to find a mythical torc buried deep down in the heart of the mountain or simply by eliminating your opponents by reducing their health points to 0 using your warriors, abilities and spells. But beware, land of Bokvyst is a mysterious place, every turn you will have to face the powers which rule this area. You have to plan your strategy on the go as the situation in the playground changes with every swing of a hammer.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rogue Trooper: Lone Trooper
boardgame.description: Official solitaire rules for Rogue Trooper from White Dwarf magazine, issue 93.

boardgame.name: Among the Archives
boardgame.description:
A hack by Caroline Berg of Alone Among the Stars originally created by Takuma Okada.

A solo, or cooperative, roleplaying game about being the last person, or group of people, to document a dying civilization.

boardgame.name: Mark Hazzard: Merc
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

In 1972, a crack commando retired from the military to a normal life with the wife of his dreams and a hope for a better future. Growing restless and realizing that his true calling was a life as a soldier of fortune, he found himself a few good men working in the American underground and they formed a crew.

Today, they survive as soldiers of fortune. If you have a problem, if no one else can help, and if you can find him....maybe you can hire Mark Hazzard, Merc.

boardgame.name: Spitfire and the Troubleshooters
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

1986. Who’d have thought college life could be this crazy?! Jenny ‘Spitfire’ Swensen, a suit of Hi-Tech MAX armor, and her five young friends, the Troubleshooters, take on the evil organization responsible for her father’s death.

BZZZ BZZZ BZZZ… SIGNAL LOST…

Codename: Spitfire. This channel is secured. Operatives have been dispatched to the field. Spitfire is deployed!

boardgame.name: PickUp
boardgame.description:
PickUp is a fast-paced basketball deck-building card game that will wow you with it's authentic basketball gameplay and 40+ visually stunning characters!

The game puts you in the roles of GM, coach, and player, interweaving chance and strategy.

In an exciting head-to-head showdown, each team starts with the same roster of players. Teams can then use their players on the court or trade them for better, more specialized players to build out their roster.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Road to War: 1898-1914
boardgame.description:
Did you ever dream being the Empress of an Empire on which the sun never sets and who rules the seas;
or to get the rightful place in the sun for your nation, spreading your Kultur and influence, challenging Britania’s mastery of the oceans and deterring jealous rivals with an army nobody can match alone;
or to free your Slavic brethens from oppression, getting access to the warm seas and dominating Asia;
or to fulfill your ‘Mission Civilisatrice’ and perhaps even recover your lost provinces?

This game is for you!

An historical boardgame for 4 players

Card driven, with events and card points, you take the head of one of the most formidable powers of the era, from 1898 to a possible Great War.
You will garner victory, prestige, strength and influence by making alliances, destroying adverse ones, controlling up to 11 other secondary powers, placing troops and colonies to expand your empire and hinder rival ones, fomenting strikes and colonial uprisings, leading the naval and armament races, all this under the threat of a looming world war.
Fashoda, US-Spanish war, Russo-Japanese war, the Boers, the Great Game, German Naval league and Sarajevo are now all yours to confront and overcome…

—description from the publisher

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Shadows in the Mist
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

"There is a rot in the heart of Anvilgard. While the Anvils of the Heldenhammer looked outward, a cabal of Aelven outcasts has taken root within the city. Known as the Blackscale Coil, this mysterious group has infiltrated every facet of Anvilgard’s society, and seeks to make the city their own. But the Coil is not all there is to worry about – an even greater threat lurks in the mist…

Venture into the deadly mist-shrouded streets of Anvilgard in the first ever campaign for Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound. Shadows in the Mist is a sprawling six-part campaign set within the free city of Anvilgard and sees a group of Soulbound heroes tasked with rooting out corruption in the city and exposing the mysterious Blackscale Coil — an organisation made up of members of the Darkling Covens, Scourge Privateers, and other Aelven outcasts. The Coil has used coercion, bribery, and violence to gain a stranglehold on the city. Even the Grand Conclave that is supposed to govern Anvilgard seems to have been infiltrated by the Coil, making it impossible to know who to trust. But an even greater rot is growing in the heart of Anvilgard, one that could consume the city entirely if it is not stopped in time.

This 256 page book contains

An epic campaign told across six exciting adventures. Explore the mist-shrouded streets of Anvilgard and venture into the deadly jungles and oceans beyond its walls!

A comprehensive guide to the city of Anvilgard. Discover its history and how it was founded, explore over 70 unique and strange locations, and learn about the major players in the city — and what to do to stay out of their way!

A beautifully illustrated map of the city of Anvilgard.

New items to purchase in the city’s black markets, and new Endeavours to undertake while in the city.

50 new terrifying monsters and deadly enemies for your Binding to face!

A look into Anvilgard’s future, its fall to Morathi and her Daughters of Khaine, and the rise of Har Kuron — the City of Khaine!

5 one-page adventures set after the events of Broken Realms: Morathi and the Fall of Anvilgard."

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Club Brugge
boardgame.description:
The largest club in the country celebrates its 130th anniversary and can be discovered shortly via this exclusive Monopoly edition!

The battle for every centimetre, exciting matches that go back and forth, the insane goal that falls from the sky or the repulsive comeback: experience the most beautiful moments of Club Brugge with family and friends!

Club Brugge is and remains the biggest football club in the country. This has not changed in recent years, quite the contrary.
Dribble through Club icons from past and present.
Discover the best Club players, create your own ideal team and beat the opposition!

Monopoly Club Brugge is the ideal way to relive the blue-black's finest moments.

Bluvn Goan - We Are Bruges

The Limited Fan Edition has a stylish hand numbered sleeve. Only 1891 pieces of this edition are available.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Guilds of Bitalus
Guilds of Bitalus
Guilds of Bitalus
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Guilds of Bitalus, a 1-4 player action selection game in which you’ll take command of a band of adventurers, seeking to earn fame, respect, and reputation from the burgeoning merchant city of Bitalus. You’ll do this by taking on contracts, going on expeditions, fighting in the colosseum, and doing business in the city markets. At the end of the game, the player with the most reputation points wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Art Gallery
boardgame.description:
In this game, each player assumes the role of an artist in the disputed world of galleries. Each player has one special skill from the character and must use them wisely throughout the game.

Each turn, one of the players will be the Maecenas and make a request. Each artist must choose one card in hand that best fits the Maecenas demand, the closer you get to it, the more points you get.

For the production of Art Gallery, the game designer Igor Colares invited dozens of people, among them children, adults, professional illustrators and amateurs. For each one, Igor asked for an art and said a feeling and an element. The artists then created based on that request. What we have as a result is an incredible variation of styles and a fun walk through the subjectivity of each person.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Monasterium: Market Stall
Monasterium: Marktstand
boardgame.description: The monks have opened a market stall on the path. Every time you visit or pass it, you will get a specialty from the monasteries, that brings you advantages. With this small expansion "Monasterium" becomes even more exciting and varied.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Leuven
boardgame.description:
The student city is for sale!
Leuven, city with historical pearls, beautiful shopping streets and idyllic squares and parks.

Monopoly Leuven is the ideal way to (re) discover Leuven in a different way.
Visit St. Peter's Church, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, buy the Arenberg Castle, organize a performance in the Stadsschouwburg, go shopping in Bondgenotenlaan or treat your friends to a café on the Oude Markt.
This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Louvain has to offer.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 100 hand-numbered copies of this edition will be made. The box gets a unique, stylish sleeve and contains 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Belgian Red Devils
boardgame.description:
Discover the most famous national football team in the world now via this exclusive Monopoly edition!

The battle for every inch, captivating matches, the last minute goal for which everyone is holding their breath: experience the most exciting Red Devils moments with your family and friends!

This generation of Devils is the strongest our country has known. Both of them have experience in the best European competitions. Dribble through the national team and discover the best Belgian footballers. Lukaku, De Bruyne, Hazard, Witsel, Vertonghen, Courtois, ... put together your ideal team and beat the opposition!

Monopoly Belgian Red Devils is the perfect way to relive the best moments of this golden generation. See you at the final?

This game is bilingual NL-FR. With the English version we add maps and rules in English.

The limited edition gold comes with a hand-numbered gold leaf outer box and certificate. From this box, 1895 pieces are available.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: マーブル (MABR)
boardgame.description:
マーブル (MABR) is a word game from Japan. The 70 card deck has English letters on one side, and corresponding Hiragana on the other. With all the hiragana (including the dakuon and semi-voiced sounds) and the first letter of the romanised form (a for a, k for ki) written on both sides.

There are three different ways to play with the cards.

1) ガサゴソアルファベット Rustle Alphabet
Players put the cards spread out on the table, with the side with the roman alphabet facing up. Players choose a theme and have a limited amount of time to collect cards to make up words in Japanese that are associated with the theme. Players take up cards to make a word, seeing the Hiragana side.

For example, if the theme is 'summer', then players could make japanese words like すいか (watermelon), ひまわり (sunflower), ぼんおどり (bon odori), うちわ (uchiwa) and so on. But players can only see the roman letters on the table and there is only one card for each Hiragana. So if a player uses the R card for the Hiragana り (ri) in sunflower, then another player will not be able to complete 'bon odori'.

2) スリーレターズ Three Letters
The deck is shuffled and players are dealt three hand cards. Players hold their cards with the roman alphabet facing out to the other players.

In turn, players draw one card from the deck, and discard one card from their hand. A player is trying to get to a Japanese word using the Hiragana that they see. Once they have a word, they declare, and other players have 20 seconds to guess the word they've made from seeing the roman letters.

For example, if the player is showing KNK as their three cards, is their word きのこ (mushroom), or きんこ (Kinko), or こんき (Konki)?

3) もやもやメモリーズ Misty Memories
This is a team game played in 2 v 2 or 3 v 3.

Players are at a reunion, having a nice conversation. However, it's been a long time, and memories are hazy. Try to get through it with a reasonable answer!

Players use the cards they have been dealt to compose word using all the vowel sounds, AEIOU. The theme is decided by the letters on top of the deck, such as N → "The moment I wanted to cry". Then one team asks the other team to tell a story, using the roman letters to make a word key to the story. For example "Tell us about that time when you really wanted to cry. It was about... TKS!" The challenged team has to reach into their memories, and recount a story using a Japanese word formed from TKS and vowels. If they can make up a good story, they get awarded points.
user summary

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Hasselt
boardgame.description:
Hasselt has it: its own Monopoly!

Hasselt, provincial capital, trendsetter and ideal base for the province: Limburg begins here.

Historical sights are combined with art, culture, gastronomy and a vibrant atmosphere.
Monopoly Hasselt is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way.
Walk through the rich history and culture of the city, but make sure you don't end up in jail!

Visit the cathedral, build a hotel in the TT district, take a stroll in the Japanese Garden, go to the Jeneverfeesten or run a stall at Pukkelpop! Hasselt is a city on a human scale where past, present and future embrace one another.

This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beautiful things Hasselt has to offer. This unique edition is a must-have for every Hasseller, or Hasselt lover.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 100 hand numbered copies of this edition will be made. The box gets a unique, stylish sleeve and contains 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Ieper
boardgame.description:
Ypres, City of Cats, City of Peace and Pearl of the Westhoek.

Historic sights are combined with art, culture, gastronomy and a vibrant atmosphere.
Monopoly Ypres is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way.
Stroll through the rich history and culture of the city but beware of ending up in prison!

Visit the cathedral on the Vandenpeereboomplein, buy a hotel on the Vismarkt, take a stroll on the Fortifications, go to the Ypres Rally or join the Kattenstoet!
Ypres is a city on a human scale where past, present and future embrace each other.

This Monopoly-edition takes you to all the beauty that Ypres has to offer. This unique edition is a must-have for every Ypres-lover.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Sint-Niklaas
boardgame.description:
The capital of Waasland is for sale! Sint-Niklaas, city of historical pearls, beautiful shopping streets and idyllic squares and parks.

Monopoly Sint-Niklaas is the ideal way to (re)discover Sint-Niklaas in a different way.
Visit the Sint-Nicolas Church, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, buy the Witte Molen, organise a show in the Stadsschouwburg, go shopping in the Stationsstraat or take a stroll in the De Ster recreation area.
This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Sint-Niklaas has to offer.

This unique publication is a must-have for every Sint-Niklaas citizen or Sint-Niklaas-lover.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 91 copies of this edition will be made. The box will have a unique, stylish hand numbered sleeve.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Oostende
boardgame.description:
Ostend, the queen of seaside cities, the most beautiful on the Belgian coast, has its own Monopoly.

Historical sights are combined with modern architecture, art, culture and a lively atmosphere.
Monopoly Oostende is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way.
Visit the Sint-Petrus-en-Pauluskerk, buy the stadium of KV Oostende, build a hotel on the seawall, take a walk on the picket fence or treat your friends during the Paulusfeesten.

This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Ostend has to offer. This unique edition is the must-have for every Ostend or Ostend enthusiast.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Ensor Edition. Only 160 hand-numbered copies of this edition - in honor of 160 years of Ensor - are made. The box will have a unique sleeve with James Ensor's self-portrait and will contain 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Full Fathom Five
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Taking inspiration from Moby Dick, Full Fathom Five puts the players aboard a whaling vessel in 1847. As the ship sails across the Pacific Ocean strange and terrible events unfold.

You’ve been at sea for 13 months. There’s salt in your beard, and weevils in your biscuits!

The scenario is intended for four to six players, with advice included for running with fewer (all the way down to one Keeper and one player). The game usually runs in a single intense session of play.

Full Fathom Five is designed for use with the 7th Edition Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game, and includes:


Period character sheets designed specifically for this scenario;
Pre-generated characters for your players;
Black and white portraits for each of the 23 crew members;
Deck plans (2);
Crew rosters (one for the Keeper and one for the players);
Player handouts;
Advice on how to run and present the scenario;
A black & white version;
A separate file of handouts ready for you to print out at home.

boardgame.name: Ryder: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
A game where luck is cast aside in honour of memory, strategy and, after some time, skill. Set in the time of knights & wizards.

Battle your friends to earn the most tributes and buy your passage home.

Each player has 4 cards dealt to them, face down and takes it in turns to combat their foes around the table. You may look at your cards but cannot move the position of them. You select your cards to attack other players face down cards and then begin the process of endeavoring to remember where all the cards are, who to attack, what skills to play on opponents to mess with their gameplay etc.

Designed to remove the "Luck" element of card games and instead grant the winner victory via superior memory or strategic skills. With additional elements such as War Cry's and individual card skills, there's plenty to laugh about while playing.

–description from the designer

boardgame.name: UNO Bundle Collector Tin
boardgame.description:
What a great gift for your friends who love to play games: UNO, PHASE 10, and SNAPPY DRESSERS in one premium collectible tin! Which one will they play first?

UNO: Match colors and numbers to be the first to get rid of all your cards.

PHASE 10: Players must complete rummy like hands to move through all 10 phases of the game.

SNAPPY DRESSERS: the delightfully creative card game in which every card matches in one way with every other card in the deck. It's the ultimate game collection for super-fun nights in with family and friends. Gather your friends and play all three!

Three classic games for nights in with family and friends

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nubarron: The adventure of an unlucky gnome
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The gnome have had it's lucky hat stolen! Help him out to recover it as you meet a bunch of fairy tale creatures along the way.

boardgame.name: The Jester and the Minstrel (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
It’s fair time in the region of Carcassonne! Travelling minstrels, jesters, jugglers, musicians and magicians gather together to provide fun and festivities for the peasants. News of the fair is spread far and wide, with some of the entertainers travelling the nearby countryside to announce the fair’s whereabouts. Some of these travelling showmen perform song and dance for their onlookers; others provide a bit of tom foolery and distract peasants from their duties.
Expands the Catapult with two new followers: the jester and the minstrel.

boardgame.name: Tapestry: Laserox Organizer
boardgame.description:
Create the civilization with the most colorful history, starting at the beginning of humankind and reaching into the future. The paths you choose will vary greatly from real-world events or people — your civilization is unique! Get your civilization prepared with this unique organizer designed for Tapestry and Tapestry: Plans and Ploy expansion.

Get your game going within 5 minutes. This organizer has a 3 slot card dispenser with built in places for the open cards during gameplay. The buildings are logically sorted and labelled for quick access. No more minute long searching, which building is the one you are looking for.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Flip-Tiles: Wilderness Perils Expansion
boardgame.description:
Paraphrased from publisher's blurb:

24 double-sided full-color 6" x 6" tiles, depicting dangers in wild areas, like chasms, sinkholes, churning surf, quicksand, boggy swamps, or wildfires. Expanding the Wilderness Starter Set.

Wet, dry, and permanent markers erasable.

Expands the Wilderness starter set.

boardgame.name: Lauschwunder
boardgame.description:
A memory game in which you don't have to find pairs of pictures but pairs of towers that sound the same. The towers are filled with material such as shells, pebbles, sand and much more.

The towers can also be filled with your own objects.

–user summary

boardgame.name: The Fall of the Children of Bronze
boardgame.description:
You ask what the Jackals do in the Zaharets. I ask you, what happens if they do nothing?
- Nawsi Namar of Orsem Honess, speaking to the Sar of Ameena Noani

The Fall of the Children of Bronze is a grand campaign for Jackals, and includes 14 adventures spanning 9 years. Players will explore the ancient myths and legends of the War Road, from the bustling streets of Ameena Noani in the north and Sentem in the south, to abandoned temples in the wastes and mansions deep within the earth. They will encounter beings and powers from the past - ancient but far from dormant - and come face to face with the hidden hand that would the Law of Men torn down and chaos brought to the Zaharets.

boardgame.name: Cactus Town: The Lone Ranger
boardgame.description:
An expansion to Cactus Town introducing the solo mode & 5th player mode. It also introduces a new asymmetric party to Cactus Town: The Lone Ranger.

Commissioned by the Federal Marshal, his objective is to keep everyone in check until the Marshal’s task force arrives, not trusting anyone but himself. A new game mechanic based on round events will put a time-limit on your games, ending the game when the event deck is depleted and the Marshal arrives.

In the solo mode, you will take on the role of the Outlaws and experience a race against the clock to get your job of plundering done before the Marshal shows up… all the while the Lone Ranger will tamper with your plans, being your automata opponent.

In a 2-5-player game, you can take on the role of the Lone Ranger yourself, trying to prevent anyone else from fulfilling their objectives and manipulating events to win time and speed up the arrival of the Marshal. Note that the Lone Ranger is a necessary faction for any 5p games, since he puts a natural time limit on the game.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hotel Lovecraft
boardgame.description:
Hotel Lovecraft enables you to create a terrifying and unsettling experience in the comfort of your own home. Based on the works of the master of cosmic horror H.P. Lovecraft, it blends roleplaying, adventure gamebooks and audio horror theatre into a hybrid entertainment.

In a darkened candlelit room or even over the internet via video chat, you will take your guests on a journey through a world of twisted nightmares and reality-bending encounters.

To Play
One or all of you will take on the role of host. It will be their job to read from the book. The other players must create their persona and then within 5 minutes be ready to enter the twisted rooms of Hotel Lovecraft.

If they get through all six floors of the building and escape alive maintaining their reality, they win. Fail, and they never check out.

Each room has its own specially designed soundscape and narration, once entered you will be given four choices, from which you must choose before you are allowed to descend further. The HOST will tell them of the results and elaborate upon the story to bring the players deeper into the adventure.

A player will start on the top floor of “Hotel Lovecraft”. Play or read the Acts in order, before the player can start opening each door to the floor. They must open all but one of the doors on each floor before the lift will allow them to move to the next level. They can if they wish to revisit a floor, once they have activated the lift.

Players will start with full HEALTH and Zero MADNESS. If the players lose all their HEALTH or REALITY points, the game ends for them.

boardgame.name: Bag of Butts
Popobeutel
boardgame.description:
Bag of Butts is a "push everybody's luck game".

When it is your turn, you announce how many butts you want to draw for which butt group before your first draw. Then you draw exactly three butt groups from the butt bag. Once you have drawn all the butts from the butt bag, you choose which one butt group you want to score. Not only you yourself though but everybody will get butt points for each of their butts in the butt group that you are scoring. The next player will then add a random special butt to the butt bag before they, too, draw all the butts. These change the game up a little but, more importantly, each player butt is also worth an additional butt point for each special butt that is in play.

Once you reach at least 28 butt points, the game ends with the next reset. A reset happens either because a player decides against adding another special butt to the bag or because there happens to be one or more special butts in each of the three butt groups that a player draws. Just because you are the first player who reaches 28 butt points does not necessarily mean that you will actually win the game.

—description from the publisher

Dann ziehst du sämtliche Popos aus dem Popobeutel. Dabei möchtest du zumindest eine Popogruppe ziehen, die dir mehr Popopunkte bringt als du deinen Mitspielern gleichzeitig in ihre Popos pustest. Zielsicher das kleinste Übel zu wählen, wird umso kniffliger, je mehr Sonderpopos im Popobeutel landen.

boardgame.name: Chinchiller Dice
Chinchiller-Würfel
boardgame.description:
Chinchiller Dice is a bluffing game of literal blind trust.

When it is your turn, you roll the two dice, trying to score as much sand from the general supply as possible. You may re-roll any die that has not landed special side up as often as you like. Sooner or later though you will roll two chinchillers and have to close an eye.

Once both your eyes are closed, you can not re-roll any dice any more when it is your turn again. Instead, your left neighbor will tell you what you have rolled after just one roll. Your neighbor will also be the one who will have to pay for any sand you are scoring while blind. As a result, there is a good chance your neighbor will try to cheat you. It will be up to you to either accept your neighbor's word blindly or to try to catch them in the act. However, if you are greedy while your neighbor is telling the truth, you will be the one losing precious sand.

—description from the publisher

Falls du es allerdings übertreibst und zwei Chinchillers wirfst, musst du ein Auge "chinchillaxen". Schließt du beide Augen zu früh, werden dich die Mitspieler um deine Punkte prellen. Title: Chinchiller Dice Publisher: Loosey Goosey Games Language(s): English German

boardgame.name: Tofu God
Tofugott
boardgame.description:
Tofu God is a party game of story snippets.

You will use cards showing silhouettes, mostly of animals, in an attempt to fill out the proverbial blanks you are dealt in the form of questions. Meanwhile, everybody else will try to intuit your answers and, more importantly, also which silhouettes you have chosen to represent them.

When it is your turn, you will answer one of two randomly drawn conundrums. To do this you will have eight of your ten silhouettes to pick from. For each of the three questions that make up your conundrum you will secretly decide on the best and the worst answer from your point of view. Question by question, everyone else will try to guess your favorite answer. Whenever someone is correct, both you and that player will get a point. However, if a player mistakenly thinks that your least favorite answer might be your favorite one, that player loses one point. The game ends when everyone has had the same amount of turns. If you manage to earn the most points, you win.

—description from the publisher

BS22-5

boardgame.name: Valley of the Lost
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Seemingly created by mad gods, the Valley of the Lost has been reshaped as if all creation has been allowed to run amok. Will you succumb to the toxicity of the Path of Madness or meet your end in the darkness of the Path of Shadows? Perhaps the guardians of the Path of Light will be your undoing or will you wander endlessly on the Path of the Lost until you meet your demise? These are the dangers that must be endured to reach the Ascent of Kings and discover the Valley of the Lost.

boardgame.name: Uphill
boardgame.description:
Uphill is set in Discrimi Nation, where he inhabitants fight an intense battle, in which the wind favors the Nobles in power, while the peasants are desperately trying to climb the social ladder.

Each player gets warriors at random.

The peasantry hands over its strongest warriors to the nobility, while in turn the nobility passes its weakest warriors to the peasantry. Sounds fair? Depends on who you ask.

After that, based on how strong their army is, each player has to guess how many battles they are going to win.
Then the war begins: The King/Queen starts the game with placing a card on the table. Other players has to play a card with the same color. The stronger warrior hits the weaker (higher number hits the smaller one). The round is won by the player who played the highest card in the given color.

Based on the number of battles won, and how close were your guesses, power is redistributed, and ranks get swapped. You win some, you lose some.

And a new battle begins…

The player who can hold his/her Royal title 3 times in a row, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Postcards from Cable Street: RPGs Against Fascism
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Postcards From Cable Street is an anti-fascist rpg charity zine.

It features exclusive content for systems such as Mothership, Troika! Best Left Buried, PBTA and self-contained systems, as well as a number of essays, an interview and original games.

boardgame.name: Pip System Primer (Volume 3, Issue 12 - Spring 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters don't scare us because they only existed in stories from hundreds of years ago. They scare us because they may walk among us, skulking in the shadows of our cities and thickest patches of our wilds. It was only a matter of time before they were discovered in our modern times, hiding in plain sight with our ignorant dependence on rational thought, making it a challenge to see what was right in front of us. They are here and they live among us. Demons, fae creatures, wizards, and every fantastic idea imaginable live in your building, work at your office, and dated you in college.

The world has become a more magical place.

Pip System Primer #12 provides articles, references, archetypes, extras, and an original cryptid-themed escape adventure for the Pip System. All from the original Pip System publisher.

Includes:

"Pip Goes Urban Fantasy" by Todd Crapper
"A More Authentic Table" by Erykah Fasett
"The Cursed & The Gifted" by Todd Crapper
"Urban Magic" by Erykah Fasett
"Urban Fantasy Archetypes" by Brennan Bishop
"The Skeleton Gate" an adventure by Elise English
plus extras and pre-generated characters for any urban fantasy Pip System game

boardgame.name: MaximumHP (Issue #005 - 1e)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maximum HP is a tabletop RPG 'zine relating to the world's favorite tabletop game regarding to Dragons and Dungeons. For 1E of the world's favorite roleplaying game.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Quest Adventure
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Quest Adventure is an text adventure from Hewson. The player can choose to play as five different characters: Wizard, Cleric, Rogue, Fighter or Simpleton.

boardgame.name: Guntia: schnick's dir !!!
boardgame.description:
In the game Guntia, you move your piece by rolling the dice on a map through the district of Günzburg to occupy free communities. You succeed in occupying a municipality if you win an extended Rock Paper Siccors (+2 more gestures) against your fellow players. Once a municipality is occupied, it may no longer be entered by other players, with the exception of the two municipalities in the centre. If a player has conquered 10 communities, or if a player cannot move for two rounds, the game is over. Points are awarded for occupied municipalities, as well as castles or coats of arms in the municipal area.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Akashic Classes: Kheshig
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wear Your Power!
Akashic Classes: Kheshig is the latest volume in our series of class-focused player supplements for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, expanding the options for using the mystical powers of akasha. The kheshig is a powerful warrior who blends akashic prowess and physical might to become the perfect bodyguard – or a deadly hunter. Alongside the kheshig in this book are 14 new melee weapon veils, 5 new ranged weapon veils, 8 new armor veils, and 30 additional veils to mix and match to create your perfect frontline fighter. This book also features a new weapon, the armored fist, allowing you to dive into melee with your fists, while still offering some protection. Finally, there’s 8 additional feats for martial characters and veilweavers alike, from fighting with a single weapon or being able to swap out powerful weapon veils at will. Whether you want to create a perfect bodyguard or a powerful hunter, the kheshig, clad in akasha, can help you achieve your goals.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Module T2: Spiderhorse Rustling
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A ranch just outside the city of Ereslus is raising spiderhorses, a new kind of mount for the Ereslus military and the Knights of the Chalice. Recently, however, spiderhorses have been mysteriously disappearing from the ranch. The Knights of the Chalice have commissioned the heroes to find out what is happening...

Spiderhorse Rustling
A 2 to 4-hour 5th Edition adventure for 4-6 low-level characters.

boardgame.name: Underground Lake Research Center
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Listening Station

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of an Underground Lake Research Center. It has Hex, Square and No Overlays; it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“The crystal, what is its purpose? Why was it buried here in the sands beneath a lake and a mountain?”—Research Scientist

Underground Lake Research Center includes a single interior map of an underground research facility dedicated to studying a lake underneath a mountain. Recently a mysterious artifact has been removed from the lake and is contained in the warehouse room. Data is being compiled and sent to a futuristic office room with holographic display technology. A pneumatic elevator and personnel hatch allows access to the lake below powered by a trio of generators.

Underground Lake Research Center is intended for use in far-future science fiction games. It could also be repurposed as a bunker or as an expansion to The Bunker in a SciFi post-apocalyptic game.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

The Thing from Beneath the Lake: A mysterious crystalline relic was recently dug up from the sands of an underground lake. A research scientist is studying the device in a containment pod. When beams of light are focused on the crystal, it reveals information that is displayed all around the crystal in refracted light after passing through the relic.

A civilization that lives in the deep, dark, underground waters wants the relic back and sends a team to retrieve it. This civilization could be comprised of humanoid lake creatures adapted to the dark conditions, aliens from another world, or monsters with tentacles here to prevent man from knowing what he should not. The player characters can be playing a group of mercenaries hired to protect the facility. The northwest hull door is breached as the creatures swim into the facility…

boardgame.name: The Scourge of the Scorn Lords
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the third and final installment of the Meatlandia Trilogy and the immediate follow-up to our Ennie-nominated book, Worm Witch: the Life and Death of Belinda Blood.

The Scourge of the Scorn Lords is a mashup of Mad Max, Fist of the North Star, Dark Sun, and the Beastmaster, with a healthy dose of The Land That Time Forgot for good measure.

The Scorn Lands
A mad wasteland full of harsh monsters, bands of cannibalistic marauders, and the savage Scorn Lords. This massive setting includes maps, encounter tables, rules for dehydration and heat stroke, and more!

The Scorn Lords
An ancient brood of sorcerer-demigods that rule the Scorn Lands with an iron fist. Some will try to kill you, but it's the ones who want to hire you that you need to truly wary about. Scourge of the Scorn Lords was written for faction play, allowing to you to join them and lead their forces, battle them with plucky rebels, or in true Kurosawan fashion, play them off one another.

Psionics
A full OSE-compatible ruleset for running psionics, with 23 psionic powers, rules for generating wild talents, and a new psionic character class!

New Classes
The mind-bending Mentalist, the beast-besting Monster Honcho, the ghostly Fade, and the insectoid Myrmeke bring a taste of your favorite versions of the apocalypse to the Scorn Lands. Keep track of your Scorn Lands characters with your very own Scourge of the Scorn Lords Character Reference Sheet!

Vehicles and Animals
Rules for creating desert-driving contraptions, outfitting them for war, and pulling them with horses, camels, elephants, giant insects, and dinosaurs!

New Weapons, New Armor, and New Equipment
Gladiator weapons, non-lethal weapons, rules for building awesome suits of piecemeal armor, equipment to help survive the wastes, and insane new stuff for outfitting your wasteland vehicles.

Tables Galore
Encounter Tables, Rumor Tables, Village Tables, Background Tables, and more—everything you need to run a massive sandbox in our mighty wasteland. You can run this game with almost no prep time whatsoever.

boardgame.name: Wide-Eyed Terror
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A blood-curdling scream rings out, traveling in the autumn air. A door slams. The sound of something breaking branches tears through the brush and is followed by several sharp, unnatural barks. Then, near silence as the wind kicks up. The only thing heard for the next few moments is the rustling of the wind and blowing leaves.

Wide-eyed Terror is a compact DCC RPG -compatible roadside encounter for 12-16 0-level characters or 5-6 level-1 characters. It details 13 individual areas, but plays as a tense, fast-paced encounter with multiple moving parts as the party inevitably splits up. It will take 1.5-2 hours for your players to complete.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Sphinx (Issue 4 - Oct 1998)
boardgame.description: Phantastik-Magazine, Spielerezensionen, Bücherrezensionen, Szene-Infos, Vereine und Clubs, alles über Cons, Terminkalender, Adressliste
boardgame.rpgissue: Sphinx - Szene-Magazin für Rollenspiel und Phantastik

boardgame.name: Gravity RIP
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

PRO-RACING. ANTI-GRAVITY. Gravity RIP is a co-operative tabletop RPG built to tell the rad-as-hell stories of pilots competing in the RIP Racing League.

A theatre-of-the-mind tabletop system for 1,200km/h sci-fi racing adventures, with distinct modes of play for both furious anti-gravity racing, and off-track drama. This softcover print edition of the manual is printed in premium colour and comes bundled with a free digital PDF version of the game.

TWO MODES OF PLAY:

Story Mode describes off-track action. Expect tough talk, flourishing rivalries, underhand deals, secret meetings, mechanical sabotage and more.
Racing Mode is a polite term to describe the metal-crushing carnage that unfolds when 20 Machines battle furiously for survival and glory in a no-holds barred contest of speed. Keep track of your position in the pack - and that of your Rival(s) - to complete your objective and stay alive.

boardgame.name: Solarian Solarjammers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Starship Builder Kit has been designed to allow you to utilize various stylized starship sections to compile your very own custom starship deckplan. You can use any graphics editing software that support PNG format to combine the piec-es, drop them directly into your favorite virtual tabletop (VTT) application, or even print and cut them out to be put together to make a tabletop play map.

This series of kits is designed to allow you to mix-and-match any of the sections included herein with sections included in other sets in the series.

Herein you will find over 20 ship sections including three sample ships built utilizing the included resources are area sections.

boardgame.name: Starship Deckplans: Volume III
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This digital product contains a series of high-resolution starship deckplans in PNG format with transparent backgrounds. These deckplans are the sample starships from the Starship Deckbuilder Kit series from Paths to Adventure. If you would like to build your own custom starship deckplans in this style be sure to check out the kits. The file name of each PNG included in this product indicates which kit was used to compile the specific deckplans.

This product is part of the Paths to Adventure Space VTT Set. Hundreds of science-fiction virtual tabletop assets all pay-what-you-want.

boardgame.name: Pregame of Majority 2
boardgame.description:
Pregame of Majority 2 is a 2 player card game from Japan. It is a simplified version of the game The Majority 2

Welcome to the "Dark Council" in Nagatacho, the demon world! In this parliament, which is the center of the demon world, non-humans are still dying for their own benefit. And now, some have formed factions to gain a lot of money and power. Numbers is also power... If you gather like-minded friends, you may be able to dominate Congress. How powerful a faction can you create?

This game is a simplified version of The Majrity 2 with the theme of making factions. It is a two-player draft game played with three types of cards, and has simple rules and a unique play feeling that can be settled in five minutes. Enjoy a light game.
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Angel Fury
Gniew aniołów
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the world of the unseen!

Armies of angels and demons clash in an epic battle over a human soul. While the forces of heaven try to influence for good, the demonic fallen angels strive to draw the soul into darkness and despair. In the realm of the spirital world, mighty angel warriors try to hold their positions against onstorming demons and tormentors, by seeking to break their defenses, or by taking control of valuable crystals and living water fountains to slowly turn the tide of war to their advantage. The mighty and mysterious 6-winged seraphs summon new angels to gain a foothold on the enemy´s flank. Meanwhile the archangels, God´s chosen messengers, move like lightning over the battlefield, commanding their forces, and bringing fear to the hosts of evil. The archdemons, false gods of the ancient world, no less cunning, rise up to meet them in battle. They all know the victory belongs to the wisest leader. Are you that leader?

—description from the publisher

Take control of the forces of good or the hordes of evil. Command mighty seraphs or fierce tormentors. Each player begins with a starting deck customized by a unique general - either an archangel or archdemon. Each turn, you will use your Command markers to move troops or initiate battles and then use the cards in your hand to modify those movements or battles - or build your turn around an epic Tactics card that provides even more value! You can use your resources to deploy more units, increase your handsize, or gain more Command markers! At the end of your turn, you’ll gain more resources if you control certain Areas - or even 1 Soul Point if you control the Human Soul. When either the good or evil side has 7 Soul Points - the game is over and the soul has been claimed!

boardgame.name: Kopparhavets kapare brädspelet
boardgame.description:
In 1991, the expansion module "Kopparhavets kapare" came out for the Swedish role-playing game "Drakar och Demoner" and the module takes place in the Swedish fantasy world "Ereb Altor". Included in the expansion where rules for naval combat, which can be played together with the role-playing game or as a separate board game.
You can play different peoples such as humans, "Svartfolk" (Greenskins), "Gråalver" (Sea elves), ducks etc. Why not have a sea mage on board who is a wind weaver. Participate in "Det felisiska piratkriget" (the Felician Pirate War). Enter or ram other ships in large naval battles. Fight against the black pirate ducks of the Copper sea. Or why not attack one of the greenskin's Kyrakher with galleys that ogres and trolls are rowing.

boardgame.name: Tarnkappe (Issue 3 - Jul 1991)
boardgame.description:
DSA Spezial: Der Korianer
Universal-Schauplatz: Bund der roten Feder
AD&D Zaubersystem
reviews...

boardgame.name: Rail Barons of the World
boardgame.description:
Rail Barons of the World contains a new universal Rail Baron deck that can be used with any Railways of the World Series map as well as a solo mode for 7 Railways of the World Series maps - Eastern US, Mexico, Portugal, Nippon, Great Britain, Sweden, and Australia.

Each universal Rail Baron has a goal for the player to achieve to earn points while playing a Railways of the World Series map.

The new solo mode introduced into the Railways of the World Series adds new twists and challenges to 7 of the Railways of the World Series maps. The solo system was designed by Dávid Turczi & John Albertson.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q1 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Rail Barons of the World Board Game Expansion by Eagle Gryphon Games. Includes 22 Baron cards, 109 Solo Play cards, 15 'not in play' tokens, 1 Railbot Action token, 1 Insurance Token, 8 reference cards, plus 12 bonus baron cards. Not a stand-alone board game. This is a board game expansion for Railways of the World. Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

Title: Rail Barons of the World Publisher: Eagle-Gryphon Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Dead Flood of Dwfn Eir-Grøn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4–5 characters of levels 7–8

When a sacred dweorg festival is raided by the drow, with hundreds slain and even more enslaved, abducted, and turned into undead servitors, a deity weeps. When the divine tear becomes a flood that puts to rest the undead, the party has the chance to follow the legion of living dead on sturdy dwarven kayaks through the caverns, riding the Dead Flood of Dwfn Eir-Grøn.

The undead and their drow masters are stranded, briefly, but can the party prevail against a sheer endless legion of the living dead, punish the drow and rescue the few hardy survivors that remain?

boardgame.name: One Hundred Plus Traveling Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A long and perilous overland travel awaits the adventurers. What dangers does the wilderness present? What challenges must the heroes overcome in order to reach their destination? What will they discover along the way?

Presented here are 100 traveling events that are focused on realism and narrative-building roleplay.

This is an essential tool and reference that a GM will be able to use over and over again.

Note: This product is based on 1d100 Traveling Events, but is completely reworked and improved with lots of new events. For example; flora, fauna and weather events have been made into their own side tables.

1d100 adventure hooks and flavorful events for memorable roleplaying situations
Inspired by medieval history and real world events
Supernatural / magic references are kept to a bare minimum – gives you full control of the tone of your game
Almost exclusively non-combat content – keep using your favorite random encounter tables
Includes 12 additional support tables for excellent variation and further inspiration
Perfect for slice of life, OSR, historical and medieval fantasy games
System Agnostic – use with your favorite RPGs

boardgame.name: Darkness in the Void
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

My friends and crewmembers. Today is a great one for Galilee Heavy Industries. We have what could be a new Eden below us, and the profits to our masters and the Human Race will be great. We have some issues, however...."

Darkness in the Void
Set in the near future, Darkness in the Void is a short scenario for use with 7th edition Call of Cthulhu. This scenario is suitable for three to six players and can be completed in two nights. Humanity has explored much of the Solar System and has now set its sights on the mysteries that lie beyond.

First Contact Leads to Death and Disaster on a Strange Alien World

Galilee Heavy Industries has ordered the investigators (trained officers who work within their space program) to travel thousands of light-years from Earth, where one of their interstellar drones has discovered and begun exploring a habitable planet.

The scenario begins with the investigators awakening from suspended animation in the new system, far from home. The faster than light engines of the Pavel Sukhoi have carried the investigators across the void, powering down near a strange new world: Rizpah-160B. The planet holds mysteries and terrors the likes of which they have never dreamed of, or experienced in their worst nightmares.

The scenario is supported by 3 maps (including the map of the Pavel Sukhoi, new weapons, new skills and skill changes for use in outer space, 6 pre-gens, and two alien creatures.

boardgame.name: 民の見えざる手 (Invisible Hands)
boardgame.description:
民の見えざる手 (Invisible Hands) is a trick-taking card game from Japan.

The first king was a hero of the country and a man of great faith, but he died mad because he could not accept the overflowing voice of the people. The third king devoted all his energies to the development of the country and set up many enterprises, but the unprecedented heavy taxation caused the people to protest. The fourth king reduced taxes for the benefit of the people, but he failed to produce any results and was ridiculed as an ornament king. The fifth king finally became resentful, and instead of listening to the people, he brought great prosperity to the country by his own means, but he was called a tyrant by the people with whom he colluded, and was forced to leave his throne.

And the next king is about to be chosen from the candidates.
What do the people want from their next king?
Will they be able to live up to their hopes and show what it takes to be king?

This is a confrontational, unusual trick-taking game where you have to guess your own subject while trying to sabotage your rival's subject. It's a trick-taking game unlike anything you've seen before.
The game can be played by 3 or 4 players and there are also rules for 2 players.
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Tank Throwdown
boardgame.description:
Tank Throwdown is a game of fierce tactical armored combat played with cards on any available surface. Customize the play area and compete to be the last one standing leaving your friend's tanks in smoking ruins. Play with up to 3 players using one deck or combine multiple decks so everyone can play!

Tank Throwdown plays similarly to a tabletop miniatures game but everything you need to play is in a single deck. Players use one card to represent their tank. Gameplay is handled by manipulating a small deck of action and response cards. Terrain and bonuses add variety to the play space. Games last from 5-20 minutes and can be set up almost anywhere there is a flat surface.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Yoru: The card game
boardgame.description:
Yoru is a chaotic and quick party card game. Players battle fiercely to get the eternal scrolls and win the match. In the game there are 5 ninja clans that hold the scrolls. Each clan has unique cards with different powers. Use the cards wisely and don't forget if you run out of cards, you lose the game.

At the beginning, all players receive 1 objective card at the beginning of the game. The player's objective card cannot remain in his hand, and must be turned over until the victory condition is reached. Then the main deck is shuffled and all players are dealt 5 cards. An objective card is face up. The player who has the most black pieces of clothing begins.

Players lose if they have no cards in their hand, or if they have more than 15 cards in their hand. The player wins if he has all the scrolls of the symbols on his objective card.

boardgame.name: Cold Case: A Story to Die for
Cold Case: Eine Todsichere Geschichte
boardgame.description: The game includes fictional files and materials related to a decades-old murder. The player or players work cooperatively to study the materials, looking for clues in an attempt to solve the case. When they think they have the correct solution, the players go to the publisher's website, and answer some questions to determine how well they did.

boardgame.name: Five Parsecs From Home: Solo Adventure Wargaming
boardgame.description:
Five Parsecs From Home (3rd edition) is a solo adventure wargame where you assemble a ragtag crew of galactic trailblazers and head out to explore the stars, pick up jobs, and every now and then — engage in some action-packed, sci-fi combat!

Battles are procedurally generated with huge combinations of enemies, weapons, battlefield circumstances and objectives whether fighting rivals or carrying out jobs.

With each encounter you earn experience and loot, progressing your crew and story as you send your crew to look for contacts, trade, explore the colony, recruit replacements or train up their skills.

The game is playable with any miniatures you have on hand and requires only a small number to get started, making it ideal for both experienced and new science fiction gamers. All you need is a few six-sided dice and a couple of ten-sided dice.

184 page full-colour Royal Size (15.6cm x 23.4cm) hardback book perfect for the tabletop, packed full of full-colour art
A fast-moving system, built for solo gaming from the ground up.
Create a wide range of characters whether human, alien or robot.*
Miniatures agnostic - use whatever you have
After each battle, your crew may die from their injuries or level up and find new items and information.
Upgrade your starship with expansion modules *
Procedurally generate a huge array of possible missions, with more than 50 enemy types.
Random tables for towns, trade, character events and starship travel.
5 difficulty settings and super-hard Black and Red Zone jobs*
Extensive options for Game Mastering scenarios, allowing complex RPG-like campaigns to be played with connected scenario plots, environmental hazards and factional conflict.*
7 stage narrative solo campaign*
This is a full retail edition of the community favourite solo sci-fi wargame by Ivan Sorensen of Nordic Weasel games and comes with lots of new content (noted with a * above), full graphic layout design and lots of stunning full-colour art throughout.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: 26: PandAdventuring (Deep Space D6, Takenoko, Roll Player, Call to Adventure)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Five Parsecs From Home: Trailblazer's Toolkit

Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211) We are an online AND brick and mortar game shop located in the Los Angeles Area. The store is a labor of love between friends and brought to you by avid gamers. We TRULY appreciate your business! - Blue Gnome Games

boardgame.name: Fan Fu Football
boardgame.description:
Fan Fu Football is the live action fantasy football card game designed to play along with live or recorded football games.

Fan Fu Football brings 1 - 4 players into direct fantasy competition at every kick-off. Football is a game of "Touchdowns" and "First downs". Our simple game mechanics grant our players drive by drive action without infringing on watching the game.

Turn on a game, deal 5 cards, and on kick-off put fantasy cards "In Play". Immediately redraw to a 5-card hand (draw after every card put in play).

On every subsequent first down, put more cards in play. The first "Drive" always begins with a kick-off and player also play on first downs, so each game usually starts with two plays, to start a "Drive". Stack your cards of the same position or diversify your position cards to get maximum points on each drive of the game. Star and Rookie cards can be played at any time and can perform different actions and bonuses, as well as score points.

A "Drive" ends with a punt, turn-over, field goal or touchdown. If a "Drive” ends with a punt or turnover, score the points for the cards in "In Play" and discard them. When a "Drive” ends with a field goal or touchdown, score the points for the cards in "In Play", discard them, as well as your hand, and draw a new hand. It's just that simple.

Pick up and play on certain drives, per quarter, half, or a whole game. The easy scoring system helps keep track of the score.

Are you a gamer who loves sports too? This game was built by gamers and requires strategy. Gameplay is based on live events, guaranteeing each round of Fan Fu Football will be unique. Whether the game is high scoring or low scoring, the proper strategy will allow players to score fantasy points. Players can utilize both offensive and defensive cards during a drive, adding flexibility to strategic play.

From youth to professional, play fantasy football with any game, anytime. The portability of Fan Fu Football makes it easy to take to a friends' house or to carry when traveling. Great for game watching parties or family gatherings, combine multiple decks to add more players. You can also play a solo version, where you log your score for every solitary game and try to beat your high recorded score.

Fan Fu Football brings an extra level of fun and excitement to any game.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: + $8.00 Shipping per unit.

boardgame.name: Bom Lắc
boardgame.description:
A super ridiculous, stupid, nonsense game but extremely suprised and fun!

Roll a dice and see who is gonna exploded, the one standing still in the end is the winner.

With special ability cards, you can play up to 50 people!

—description from the back of box

boardgame.name: Tribu de Sinvergüenzas: Sigamos Pecando
boardgame.description:
New cards that will allow you to continue enjoying these gray times.

You don't need the first version to play this new edition of Tribe of Scoundrels.

Leave your shame at home.

Tribu de Sinvergüenzas: Sigamos Pecando is a drinking game in which you will face three types of challenges: Indictment, Social Defiance, and WTF Questions.

If you dare, you must accuse others, respond with truth, or share the challenge.

At game's end, the player with the most points is expelled from the tribe, while the player with the fewest is named Head of the Scoundrel Tribe and winner of this game.

–description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Soli nel Buio
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Regolamento di ambientazione fantascientifica realizzato nello stile dei primi giochi di ruolo come omaggio alle saghe di Star Trek Voyager e Battlestar Galactica.

boardgame.name: Gatti • Il Gioco di Ruolo
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Se guardando un gatto ti sei chiesto che cosa stesse fissando o perché sembrasse così soddisfatto di sé, allora forse questo è il gioco che fa per te. Gatti • Il Gioco di Ruolo spiega la "verità" sui gatti: perché sono qui, perché gironzolano attorno agli esseri umani e, soprattutto, perché sembrano sempre così compiaciuti.

boardgame.name: Truppe Coloniali 2344
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Regolamento di ambientazione fantascientifica. Prevede 4-6 amici nei panni di un gruppo male in arnese di Ribelli, con diverse competenze.

boardgame.name: Eidyllion Manuale Base
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Un sistema di metaruling che incontrerà i gusti dei master di giochi di ruolo da tavolo più esigenti, e che hanno parimenti voglia di sperimentare nuove forme narrative, soprattutto in appoggio all’oralità.

From the introduction:

Eidyllion rappresenta invero l’evoluzione del sistema Ellende Lyrhelei.

boardgame.name: Creature del Crepuscolo
boardgame.description:
Manuale dei Monstri

From the back of the book:

Oltre ai guardiani, il mondo del crepuscolo è abitato da creature fantastiche e allo stesso tempo temibili, se non letali. Esseri partoriti dalla mente dei cantori durante il proprio eidyllion, e sfuggiti al loro controllo. Molte di loro adesso infestano o abitano la maggior parte delle zone del mondo del crepuscolo; ma ciò che le rende davvero terrificanti è la loro capacità di fare letteralmente incursione all’interno della narrazione di un guardiano, squarciando il sottile velo dell’illusione che separa il narratore dal proprio elemento immaginario.

boardgame.name: Eidyllion - La Caduta Deglin Ultimi Guardiani
boardgame.description:
Regole Supplementari

From the introduction:

Il materiale contenuto all’interno di questa raccolta rappresenta un’integrazione delle regole base. In particolar modo, questo add-on è soprattutto indicato ai giocatori o ai master che muovono i loro primi passi all’interno del Mondo del Crepuscolo, dando finanche la possibilità di giocare alcuni guardiani del tempo antico.

boardgame.name: Allegati Foglie Elfich & Schedi
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This collection includes several PDF documents, including:

5-page print-and-play cards
Four 1-page pre-generated characters
Character sheet
Guardian sheet
Scenario sheet

boardgame.name: Fairy Song
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Questo scenario, studiato per il gioco di eidyllion, ha il pregio di contenere all’interno della sua struttura un locus dinamico in grado di dare ai giocatori molteplici elementi d’interazione, soprattutto in qualità di guardiani.

Lo scenario fa uso di tutte le componenti possibili di un setting studiato per un circolo di narrazione; pertanto si comincerà con un preludio in ruolo per poi avviare il tutto a una vera e propria mini campagna, grazie all’interazione con il drago blu di nome torvendral.

Fairy Song concentra in sé tutti quegli elementi che sono necessari a realizzare pienamente le potenzialità di eidyllion e a dare al giocatore una visione più ampia dell’impiego delle regole contemplate nel manuale base.

boardgame.name: Pandora's Box
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Pandora’s Box fa uso di tutte le possibili componenti di un setting studiato per un circolo di narrazione, portando alle sue estreme conseguenze le regole di metaplaying; pertanto si comincerà con un preludio per poi avviare il tutto a una vera e propria mini campagna, grazie alla presenza del vaso di pandora (individuato da una scatoletta fisica che viene impiegata all’interno dell’eidyllion).

Pandora’s Box concentra in sé tutti quegli elementi che sono necessari a realizzare pienamente le potenzialità di eidyllion e a dare al giocatore una visione più ampia dell’impiego delle regole contemplate nel manuale base e nei vari add-on.

boardgame.name: Mirrormask
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Il materiale contenuto all’interno di questo compendio rappresenta un’integrazione alle regole base di Eidyllion GdR. In particolar modo, questo add-on aggiunge altri nuovi Guardiani del Crepuscolo e alcuni relativi Eidola, pronti da giocare, contraddistinti da una forte caratterizzazione e dalla presenza di nuove regole che i giocatori potranno integrare facilmente con quelle già esistenti. Mirrormask fornisce inoltre ai giocatori alcune referenze e approfondimenti del background presente nel manuale base (l’Ephemera e la tecnologia Hopliades).

boardgame.name: Planeshift
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Il materiale contenuto all’interno di questo compendio rappresenta un’integrazione alle regole base di Eidyllion GdR. In particolar modo, questo add-on aggiunge una serie di Locus, dal più semplice al più complesso, che permette ai giocatori di far esperienza con sessioni sempre più accattivanti e in piena sinergia con i propri Guardiani.

boardgame.name: Euristica
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Il materiale contenuto all’interno di questo compendio rappresenta un’integrazione alle regole base di Eidyllion GdR. In particolar modo, questo add-on aggiunge un sistema di regole avanzate che modifica profondamente l’assetto di un Eidyllion e la sua conduzione.

Euristica fornisce inoltre ai giocatori la possibilità di estendere in maniera sorprendente le abilità e i poteri non solo dei Guardiani, ma anche degli stessi personaggi in quanto loro costrutti proiettivi.

boardgame.name: Timeshift
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Il materiale contenuto all’interno di questo compendio rappresenta un’integrazione alle regole base di Eidyllion GdR. In particolar modo, questo add-on aggiunge un nuovo regolamento per condurre gli Eidyllia in maniera accattivante e ai limiti della sfida. Un modulo studiato, in maniera profonda, per l’Auriga, con il quale animare più che mai i Circoli di Narrazione, utilizzando il Tempo come strumento di narrazione e di profondo metagame.

Timeshift fornisce inoltre ai giocatori alcune referenze e approfondimenti del background presente nel manuale base.

boardgame.name: Vitamors Conspiro
ヴィータモーズ：生死逆謀
生死逆謀
維塔穆斯：生死逆謀
boardgame.description:
In the realm of the Grim Reapers, it is the Joker’s party who rules, for now. They oppress the reapers and banish the heretics. The banished Grim Reapers wish nothing but regaining their power, so they assemble secretly, endeavoring to take back their control over the Reaper’s Realm through a mysterious sacrificial ritual. However, the assembly room is already penetrated by the Jokers --- the orders of the offerings are disrupted, and the real class of the offerings can’t be identified! The clock is ticking, and the right moment for the ritual is about to pass. The Exilers have no choice but to start a “Life-and-Death” battle with the Jokers……

"Vitamors Conspiro" is a social deduction game of hidden loyalty. Players take the role of either the “Exiler” or the “Joker”, through “Offering Up a Sacrifice” and “Start the Ritual” to attain victory. Players may start the ritual whenever the number of the character cards on the altar meets the requirements; however, to start the ritual successfully, the combination of the character cards have to be correct, too. That means players may also win the game by cheating their opponents, misleading them to start the ritual with a wrong combination and cause the ritual to fail. When there are 9 character cards on the altar, yet the ritual hasn’t been started, the Jokers automatically win the game (they are already in charge of the Reaper’s Realm, after all).

－－－－－－

目前的死神界，乃是由小丑派系所統御。祂們高壓統治眾死神，並強行流放異己。被流放的死神們心有不甘，於是秘密集結，意圖透過神秘的獻祭儀式奪回對死神界的掌控。然而，儀式的集會所早已被小丑派系滲透，不僅獻祭的順序被打亂，就連祭品的真實身分也無法辨識！眼看就要錯過儀式發動的時機，流放者們只得和小丑決一「死」戰……

《生死逆謀》是一款陣營心機遊戲。玩家將扮演「流放者」或「小丑」，透過「獻祭」並且「發動儀式」以取得勝利。遊戲中有許多資訊是隱藏的，但又有許多環節需要投票表決，因此玩家在任何時候都可以自由發言，透過討論、協商或是話術以獲得資訊，幫助己方陣營推理並有策略的投票。當然，玩家也可以選擇不透露資訊、或是提供錯誤資訊，利用資訊落差製造己方陣營的優勢。
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Play With Us Design (玩聚設計)

boardgame.name: A Player's Guide to Ptolus
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ptolus is meant to be fantasy role-playing in microcosm. It embodies all that is fundamental to the genre, but it does so in the space of a single city. That means there are dungeons to explore as well as townsfolk to interact with. There are strange magical mysteries to discover, demons to fight, and even dragons. Ptolus is truly a city of adventure—player characters don’t have to leave it to embark on amazing adventures.

Game Trade Magazine

WizKids' Indy HeroClix Superhero CMG.

Review of Midnight

boardgame.name: Dungeon Degenerates: Guttergeist
boardgame.description:
Guttergeist is a single Lowlands Monster, included with the second issue of the official Dungeon Degenerates zine: Die Wurst.

It has the following stats:
Name: Guttergeist

boardgame.name: Tierdetektiv
boardgame.description:
Content: Inflatable Globe, 68 animal clue cards, hourglass, 1 die
The players roll the die and receive a clue to an animal from a clue card. A fellow player reads out the clue. Depending on the agreed level, the fellow player gives all or fewer clues.
The active player must now find the animal on the inflated globe within a given period of time in order to receive the clue card. The first player to collect 10 clue cards or one clue card from each of the 6 different colours (continents) wins the game.

boardgame.name: 英雄对决 (Hero Battle): Ultraman
boardgame.description:
A trading card game published by Chinese collectible card publisher Kayou.
In this game, players can use heros from Ultraman Universe or Marvel Universe to fight with the opponent.
At the start of the game, each player draw 9 cards and set 5 of them on the field, other 4 cards are their hand. In each turn, player should choose a card on the field to fight the opponent, the player who has 5 heroes defeated will lose the game.

boardgame.name: The Great Race: Wild West and Far East
boardgame.description:
LATE PLEDGE OPEN!

The Great Race 2 Late Pledge is OPEN!

https://gamefound.com/projects/francois-gilles-ricard/the-gr...

Even more choices (including the core game reprint!)

Place yourself in the 1930s, at the wheel of your halftrack, where you will experience the most incredible human adventure. It is more than a race. It is THE race.

The Great Race will take you across continents, to face countless dangers and difficulties. You may have to take reckless risks to finally cross the finish line to the cheers of the crowd.

Your crew consists of mechanics, scouts and an escort that you will have to mobilize to accomplish the impossible.

Welcome to The Great Race adventure.

After having explored Africa and South America in the first campaign (TGR1), this new campaign will take you to the Wild West and the Far East, with a map of the USA and a map of Asia (TGR2).

The Wild West and Far East is both fully independent and fully compatible with the corebox from the first campaign! You can Late Pledge for TGR2 or TGR1 (or both!)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Great Race: Round the World/Duel+

boardgame.name: Silbury
boardgame.description:
Summer solstice is coming. ln order to celebrate the event, the county druids gather at the bottom of Silbury Hill to challenge each other in a big potion making tournament. Each of them is eager to show his knowledge, wisdom, and power to the great druid, who is the only judge of this competition. As tradition requires, only the winner will be entitled as the great druid disciple. Anything is fair for such an honour!

For thousands of years, a spirit has been watching over each clearing. Every spirit is represented by an animal that is engraved on the giant stones surrounding Silbury Hill. Although they protect the forest, they tolerate the presence of druids on solstice days. They are even used to help druids by giving them their power and favour, sometimes in exchange for an offering ...

boardgame.name: Raise
boardgame.description:
In this abstract family game you try to outbid your opponents in the most points-worthy rounds. Be careful not to run out of your cards! Which of you will go "all in" at the right moment and leave your opponents behind? Whoever has got the most victory points at the end will win this exciting bidding game.

Gameplay:

Everyone draws 6 cards
The starting player turns over the top point-card from the deck, rolls the dice and places them in the appropriate spots next to the game-board, sorted by symbols.
Now all of you choose exactly 1 card from your hand and place it face down in front of you. Then all cards are revealed at the same time. Now determine the values of your played cards (multiplied with the number of symbols on the dice) and place the player-tokens on the corresponding spaces on the game board.
In this phase it's always the turn of the player, whose token is furthest back, i.e. has the lowest value.


On your turn, you decide whether you want to (a) play more cards or (b) pass. (You are not allowed to draw new cards during this phase) This continues until only one player is left - which will be the winner of this round!

The game ends after a certain number of rounds.
