listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 5 Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
RAISE - Überbieten oder Passen? Ein würfeliges Kartenspiel Nichts für schwache Nerven. „Raise“ sorgt für eine ordentliche Portion Adrenalin. Nur wer im richtigen Augenblick aufs Ganze geht, kann gewinnen. Fingerspitzengefühl und das geschickte Ausspielen der eigenen Handkarten sind gefragt. Und natürlich hilft ein gutes Pokerface dabei, die eigene Taktik möglichst gut zu verschleiern.
Treiber dieser spannenden, erfrischend anderen Spieleneuheit ist das Zusammenspiel von Karten und Würfeln. Der Spielplan dient als Übersicht, er führt die Würfel- und Kartenergebnisse zusammen und zeigt so, wer die Nase vorn hat. Gespielt wird je nach Personenanzahl über acht bis elf Runden, wobei jede Runde aus insgesamt vier Phasen besteht.
Jede Phase hat ihre Eigenheiten und bringt Chancen aber auch Gefahren mit sich. Raise bietet den Spielenden verschiedene taktische Möglichkeiten, Glück spielt aber auch eine kleine Rolle. Eine spielerische Herausforderung für bis zu fünf Personen ab zehn Jahren.
Spielinhalt: 150 Zahlenkarten 14 Punktekarten 1 Übersichtskarte 7 Würfel 5 Zählsteine 1 Spielplan 1 Spielanleitung
https://youtu.be/ztcrLVLt3eA
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, FR, HU, CZ, SK, PL

boardgame.name: Kult Spiel: deutschsprachige Literatur
boardgame.description:
The players move their pieces across a playing field towards the goal by correctly answering questions about German-language literature. Each player can choose from 4 question cards, from the back of which he or she can already draw conclusions about the possible question. The player chooses a question card.

Then there are 4 possibilities: a) answer the question correctly with the announcement "Cult!" without any indication of the possible answers and move 3 spaces or b) first listen to the question and then answer correctly without any indication of the possible answers and move 2 spaces or c) listen to the question and the possible answers and answer correctly and move 1 space or d) answer the question incorrectly and stop.

The player who reaches the target field first wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: VGA Kix
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A QIX like game where you draw areas on the board without getting hit by the Kix' sparks.

boardgame.name: Ki
毀
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Japanese top-down RPG about a young man called Vossgen who's father was a brave knight who unfortunately couldn't save his wife and kid, and thus they were taken to the demonic world of Weltschmerz (World's Pain in German) where Vossgen were raised by demons and were turned into one himself.

boardgame.name: Valleria Chapter One: The Mad Alchemist
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Unravel the mystery behind a deadly disease in the first chapter of Valleria: The Mad Alchemist!

Oakheart, a once vital trading post, has been struck by a mysterious disease. Over the past month, Lord Ulric Von Vymarc, townmaster of Oakheart, has set out his men to look for the source of the disease and a cure to put a stop to the disaster. Yet they’ve failed to find any clue to what this might be.

As the weeks passed, more people got infected to the point where most of the shops had to close. The town's guard is undermanned as they’re falling ill themselves.Ships are starting to avoid the town, as rumors about a disease are starting to spread. More importantly, The Feast Of The Stars is approaching.

This would be a major source of income for the people, as many from all over the land come here to pay their respects to the gods, feast and spend many of their valuables.

The town is already accommodating the first of many visitors to come. Yet most of them leave once they find out about Oakheart’s situation.

Lord Ulric has sent out letters to renowned adventurers across Valleria to assist in this serious matter.

boardgame.name: Commerciale-City-Play
boardgame.description:
A Monopoly-like game in which players acquires shops, experiences events and answers quiz questions (16 picture cards) about famous buildings. The game does without the increases in value from houses and hotels.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dungeon Module G1: Godwyn's Law (Basic Fantasy)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The people of Forweald are terrified. What was once a bustling farming community is now a ghost town of shuttered windows and locked doors. Adventurers have broken into Godwyn’s Hill and stolen the long-dead chieftain’s magic sword. Godwyn has risen from the grave to avenge the theft. Can the heroes track down the thieves, retrieve the stolen treasure, and save the day?

Godwyn's Law
A Basic Fantasy adventure for 4 to 6 characters of levels 1–5, optimized for five 3rd-level characters.

Includes a NEW MAGIC SWORD!

boardgame.name: Temples & Tombs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Terror! Suspense! You will not believe the dangers in store for your intrepid heroes! Will they discover ancient secrets, lost civilizations, or priceless treasure? Will they escape treacherous villains, evil super powers, or deathly traps?

Temples & Tombs is a roleplaying game devoted to creating the fast-paced adventures popularized in pulp magazines that led to films like Raiders of the Lost Ark, The Mummy (1999), and Romancing the Stone.

Built on the Year Zero Engine system, the framework that drives Free League's games such as Tales from the Loop and Mutant Year Zero, Temples & Tombs is adapted to fit the two-fisted adventure pulp genre in several key ways.

Custom skills and talents engineered for a fast-paced and adventurous setting
Luck mechanic that provides more dice for added chances of success, but with a chance to "run out of luck"
Hero mechanic for additional chances to succeed
Condition-based consequences so that heroes never die (but may be on the run)
A scene structure that helps guide play to emulate your favorite action/adventure story


Beyond that, the game looks and feels like you'd expect YZ0 to feel. And if you've never played in this system, you're in for a treat. Very easy learning curve, fast-paced game play, and just enough crunch to keep things interesting.

boardgame.name: The Caravanserai
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A place of safety and rest in the desert

The Caravanserai is a printable battemap compatible with any RPG game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The Caravanserai is a day & night set, comprising of 2 30x30 battlemaps. The structure consists of a walled courtyard, with areas for stabling, accomodation, socialising and trade. Also includes a rooftop.

boardgame.name: Port Periwinkle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A small fishing village set in a cliff-bound cove

Port Periwinkle is a printable battemap compatible with any RPG game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Port Periwinkle is a day & night set, comprising of three 30x30 battlemaps. Day, night and winter versions of this small coastal hamlet, with interior overlay tiles for the tavern (ground floor and attic, day and night).

boardgame.name: Cadus Zone Scrapyard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The waste of a thousand star systems ends up here..

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30 x 30 maps depicting the a futuristic junkyard. Includes a plain and shanty-town version, plus an interior overlay for one of the ruined spaceships.

boardgame.name: The Plateau of Sighs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hex 13.22 -- The Plateau of Sighs -- features an old triceratops, out of place and out of time, and a plateau currently affected by a petrification curse caused by a gateway to the plane of earth. The gateway is at the end of a mini-dungeon, an abandoned druidic shrine to a powerful elemental prince. It includes rules for introducing ley lines into an Old School Essentials -- or any other OSR-style game -- and building ley engines, structures designed to collect and focus ley energy to be used by mortals.

boardgame.name: Olde Swords Reign Expansion I: Races and Classes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expansion I for Olde Swords Reign contains 3 new races (gnome, half-elf & half-orc), 4 new classes based on the 1974 game supplements (druid, monk, paladin & ranger), druid spells, an optional feat system and more.

boardgame.name: Springvikarierna
boardgame.description:
Springvikarierna is a boardgame where players take the role of Gig-workers competing for the scarce jobs. Main mechanic is hidden auction (how desperate are you today?). Then different life- and work-related events can trigger, sometimes making you choose from options. The two resources of the game is HEALTH and MONEY that needs to be balanced. The players who can pay the rent at end of game without "hitting the wall" wins. (So no explicit win criteria, however there are some options in the rulebook for this if you want to play it fully competitive.)

—description from the designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Battle Cattle: Quest for the Holy Pail
boardgame.description:
64 page expansion book that requires Battle Cattle second edition to play.

This Battle Cattle: second edition miniatures rules expansion book will give you the ability to play Battle Cattle in a world of swords and sorcery. Not only will the role of Battle Cattle in medieval times be explained, but you will have weapons, armor, accessories and modifications applicable to the time period. Add to this the element of moo-gic items and spells, and Battle Cattle becomes a whole new game.

—description from the back of the book

boardgame.name: Total War: Rome Remastered
boardgame.description:
Total War: ROME REMASTERED lets you relive the legacy that defined the award-winning strategy game series. Remastered to 4K with multiple improvements to visuals* as well as refinements to gameplay, it’s time to revisit a true classic. Not everyone gets a second chance to conquer the Roman Empire.

TAKE BACK YOUR EMPIRE

Boasting a barrage of visual upgrades, gameplay enhancements and modern Total War mechanics, Total War: ROME REMASTERED has everything you need as a player and could want as a fan. Build an empire, command ferocious battles and conquer ancient Rome like never before.

WHAT'S NEW
IMPROVED VISUALS

UHD resolution support
Updated 3D unit models and textures
Widescreen & Ultrawide support
Enhanced battlefield and campaign map
Improved VFX & sound mix
Enhanced Graphics Pack

MODERN FEATURES
Enhanced cameras & controls
New campaign map overlays
New tactical battle map
Unit battle status displays & range markers
Improved faction summary screen
New Quick Lists

ENHANCED GAMEPLAY
16 additional playable factions (38 total)
Cross-platform multiplayer
Classic vs Remastered gameplay modifiers
Steam Workshop mod support
New agent – the Merchant
Improved diplomacy

REDESIGNED UI
Modernised screenflow & layout
New Agent Hub and Follower screens
UI scaling
Redesigned high-res buttons & icons
Improved support for colour blindness

OVERHAULED HELP SYSTEM
Redesigned campaign tutorial
Integrated Wiki
Extensive multimedia tooltips
New first-time player advice
Improved advisor messages

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: 宝石泥棒の予告状 (Houseki Dorobou no Yokokujou)
boardgame.description:
宝石泥棒の予告状 (Houseki Dorobou no Yokokujou) is a game from Japan, meaning something like 'The Jewel Thief's Letter of Warning'. Originally produced in 2007, it was re-issued at the Tokyo Game Market in 2015.

This a trick-taking game but players don't have to -and may not want to- follow the colour (suit) lead. The cards show one, two or three colours each, and a player will receive a penalty chip for any color on their card which does follow the colour led.

The 40 card deck shows various aristocrats with their jewellery. The cards are ranked by number, and the 10 card is also a zero. Cards also show types of jewels in different clusters. The players are jewel thieves, trying to force their opponents into releasing valuable loot.

The designer says the unique scoring system can help a player overcome a bad hand.
user summary

boardgame.name: Cactus Town: The Lost Chief
boardgame.description:
This expansion introduces an all-new gameplay feeling to Cactus Town: the search for the LOST CHIEF.

Dakota will pay the town a visit in search of her father, so the party starts with one standee and (hopefully) gains a second. The player’s available actions change depending on whether Dakota is alone or reunited with her father. All the while they try to teach the townsfolk a lesson not to get involved with a Native American princess and her erstwhile peaceful tribe.

The expansion opens up new party combination options and adds yet another unique experience to how the game plays out.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stress Botics: Odyssey
boardgame.description:
Stress Botics Odyssey expands the heavy eurogame experience in 5 axes, while maintaining the basic rules and rhythm of the base game.

The first enhanced axis is the main room (the room where Alpha Bot currently is). Odyssey’s alternate board contains a zoom of the main room, and thus players will have to take into account their positioning, in order to fight against the cylindroids and defend Alpha Bot from them. If Alpha Bot does not reach the surface, deliveries to ships will be much more complex to execute!

The second enhanced axis are the Cylindroids. When the players eliminate an entire wave of enemies, a Cylindroid Elite will appear. This powerful enemy is Alpha Bot’s nemesis, and boasts its own AI and complex behaviour.

The third enhanced axis is Alpha Bot. Beta Bots will be able to access the interior of Alpha Bot through a new type of action. Once inside they will be able to control Alpha Bot's AI in order to speed up its behavior, change its direction to crush enemies or avoid obstacles, repair shields, collect resources or equip objects, among many other things. However, players will have to be cautious when interacting with AlphaBot... If it receives damage while being controlled, it will activate its other temperamental AI revealing one of its multiple aggressive behaviors, such as going back to an already explored main room or indiscriminately attacking any robot next to it!

The fourth enhanced axis is the Solo Mode. By adding Delta Bot, a small robot that will accompany us to fulfill our objectives, adventurous players can play the game on their own. Odyssey includes an additional board to be affixed to the player's blueprint in order to expand management during the maintenance phases, as well taking care of Delta Bot. If the little companion accumulates too much stress it will explode, making the game much harder for the solo player.

The fifth enhanced axis is additional content. Odyssey adds more items to the current sets, including a new type of item: the boxed items. Those can be dynamically equipped from the main room to be used more immediately, adding a touch of improvisation both to combat and to the strategies that structure the game. In addition, Odyssey includes modular boards that expand the detail of several mechanics and include unique characteristics in each player count.

boardgame.name: Cactus Town: Stampede
boardgame.description:
This expansion introduces another new asymmetric party to Cactus Town: The Cowboys and their herd of cows.

In the mix of Spaghetti Western parties, the cowboys don't want to stay behind. And they are not alone, they have brought their cattle with them. This is the craziest of all factions, the cowboys need to steer their herd through Cactus Town, guiding the lifestock to the cattle train waiting at the other side of town.

On their way, the herd will create stampedes, with the cows taking on anyone who stands in their way. Chain reactions are possible and no one is safe from the beasts. But then again, maybe you don't want to, because their movement effect might help you in your own objectives.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
Multi-language Kickstarter edition, never played.
Possible pick-up near Milan.

boardgame.name: Size Matters
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Play as a scientist who is shrinking each second as you race against time in your lab to find the ingredients for an antidote.

boardgame.name: Der letzte Held (Issue 22 - 1993)
boardgame.description:
Das Geisterschiff des Kar'Basch
"Oase" - Haus der 1000 Freuden
Auf großer Fahrt
Sukkuvelani und die nördlichen Perlenmeerinseln
Havena Fanfare
Rezensionen

boardgame.name: Mini Express Map Pack 1: Taiwan & United Kingdom
boardgame.description:
Mini Express Map Pack 1 - Taiwan & United Kingdom contains a double-sided game board with new and challenging rules for Mini Express.

You conquered the Wild West.

You conquered the Old World.

Now, your dreams of steel and steam draw you across the ocean where new challenges and opportunities await you.

1908 Taiwan

It is the dawn of the 20th century. From 1895 to 1945, Taiwan was colonized by Japan. In that time, Japan heavily invested in modernizing Taiwan’s railway system around the island, with bold plans including building tunnels and tracks through mountains. In the Taiwan map for Mini Express, the white company represents Japan. Players are seeking to expand tracks across the island, especially to the 6 major cities; however, mountains pose a logistical problem. Players can at any time invest in Japanese modernization, and it indeed comes with benefits. However, the more players do business with Japan, the tighter the restrictions are in the game. Soon, you might find your influence in a company reduced to nothing if you’re not careful. Fulfill your dreams of steel and steam! Welcome to Taiwan! 加油！

1918 United Kingdom

The Great War has finally ended, and the UK won. The economy of the United Kingdom is exploding with opportunity. Ferries to other countries are being negotiated. Harder, better, faster locomotives are being built. Construction of the London Underground begins to flourish. And rumors float about that Parliament will unite and condense the various railways across Great Britain into only a few. Opportunity awaits you in this bull economy, but can you build your railroad empire in time?

Extend the reach of your railroad empire across the globe in Mini Express Map Pack 1.

boardgame.name: A Night at Dry Creek
boardgame.description:
"A Night at Dry Creek
The Sheldon family have owned and operated the Dry Creek Roadhouse since time immemorable, serving the lost and weary travelers who have been unknowingly swallowed by the mists of Ravenloft. Hidden beneath the facade of this eccentric yet hospital family, however, lies a dark devotion to the insatiable entity living in their cellar...

Dive into this 4-6 hour Horror adventure for 3-6 players! The module is designed for 3rd level characters and to be played in a single session, but may also be incorporated into a longer campaign.

Also includes two playable battlemaps (both gridded and ungridded) as well as an Accessible copy of the adventure."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Summertime Madness
boardgame.description:
Summertime Madness
is a single-player first-person puzzle game.
The player, in the role of a painter who has made a deal with the devil, has to find his way back to the real world after being cheated and trapped into one of his canvases. A dreamlike journey into a surreal world of the artist’s own creations where the atmospheric gameplay provides mysteries to discover, puzzles to solve and artistic landscapes to explore.

Prague
July 20th 1945

The city of Prague was under siege, ravaged by war. Buildings were falling, churches were burning, and everything was to be washed away forever. A painter lived there, isolated from the outside world. The worse the terrors of war became, the more the artist obsessively painted beautiful landscapes as a contrast to the evil he had witnessed. One night, a mysterious figure appeared in the house seemingly out of nowhere. The stranger walked slowly around the room, inspecting the paintings. He then sat down in front of the artist; to offer him a deal.

The chance to enter one of his own creations, far away and free of war. But he would have to find his way back out before midnight, or else his soul would become trapped in the canvas forever. Feeling alone, on the edge of madness, terrorized by the scent of death creeping in from the streets, the artist shook the mysterious man's hand, accepting the deal. A few moments later, the house was empty.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: KuruKuru Kitchen
boardgame.description:
KuriKuri Kitchen is a game from Japan. Originally published in 2008 it was re-issued at the Tokyo Game Market in 2015.

The players are cooks in a kitchen putting meals together. There are head chefs that move about on a simple rondel of numbers. The value of the head chef aids the players. The cooks are melding card sets in the style of Mahjong and Rummy. When a player discards a card, that moves a chef around the rondel. The player can use the number of the chef to help complete a meld.
user summary

boardgame.name: Mineral Exploration
boardgame.description:
It is your responsibility to find new mineral deposits. This job requires that you be alert with all your senses, that you use the latest technology and that you make good decisions.
Make sure they are economically, socially and environmentally viable!

In Mining Exploration your mission is to explore the terrain using your exploration cards. Each terrain must be explored with an appropriate action to earn its points. The player with the highest score at the end of the deck will win the game. The standard version of the game is recommended for people 10 years and older. For players with more experience, it has a section with extensions to the rules which will add more options to the games and an advanced version of the game.
Card game designed for the Explorations Corporate Management of CODELCO (National Copper Corporation of Chile). It was distributed to children in schools in the company influence territory. The objective is to teach the work of mining exploration and basic concepts of geology and mining.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 魔幻特攻 (Magic Special Attack)
boardgame.description:
魔幻特攻, roughly translated as "Magic Special Attack", is a two player game where the players compete to score the most points.

The players are illusionists erecting barriers in an arena of limited space. When a player erects a barrier, they earn a gem of that color. In lieu of placing a normal barrier on their turn, a player may also pay a gem to place a special barrier of the corresponding color.

If through either type a barrier placement a player creates a 1x1 isolated space, they may earn a bonus gem.

One round ends when one of the players cannot place an additional barrier. The game lasts over four rounds and points are awarded for earning a certain number of gems of each color and for sets of gems. The player with the most points wins.

The game was originally released as part of the 2021 150BG.con convention in Taiwan, where games sell for 150 TWD, roughly $5 USD.

listing.notes: Played a few times. Includes an English translation.

boardgame.name: Hungry Cells
boardgame.description:
Hungry Cells
Cells are the basic unit of life and of course, they have a lot of work to do! They are responsible for living beings to grow, breathe, walk, think and dream ... For this they need a large amount of energy and nutrients. In Hungry Cells you will know these nutrients and you will feed your favorite cell!
In Hungry Cells the players adopt the role of a cell, they must acquire the 6 nutrients that a cell needs to survive, the first cell to get them wins the game, but be careful! One cell may rob another of the nutrient already close to it.
Designed to teach the chemistry of food. It was the centerpiece of the annual booklet of the Science Week activities 2011, conducted by the EXPLORA CONICYT program (National Commission for Scientific and Technological Research) of the Ministry of Education of the Government of Chile. Hungry Cells was distributed along with the newspaper “La Tercera” throughout the country. Players had to craft the game with the central pages of the booklet.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Last Aurora: Player vs. Player
boardgame.description:
The enemies of your enemies... are still your enemies!

This module allows players to fight each other during the game!

boardgame.name: Last Aurora: Carte Promo
Last Aurora: Promo Card Pack
boardgame.description:
Do you need a new vehicle?
A crazy big weapon?
Or helpful Survivors?
No problem!

This module includes new additional cards you can add to the Exploration deck.

boardgame.name: Last Aurora: Role Cards
boardgame.description:
Survival in these frozen lands requires a lot more than luck. You’re going to call upon every skill and trick you know if you’re going to make it through.

This module includes Role cards you can add to your games to provide asymmetrical gameplay!

User Summary

18 pictures of animals - with logic riddles.

boardgame.name: Karukinka
boardgame.description:
Strange signs appear in the forest. Snow and frost show up earlier than expected. Why is summer coming to an end so soon? Venture out to investigate what is happening in the Karukinka Forest Boilers while escaping fearsome predators and saving resources to survive the harsh winter ahead.

In Karukinka, players take on the role of one of the squirrels in the Karukinka Forest. They must go through a first phase of the game, the warm phase, looking for seeds that allow them both to save and to acquire equipment, while facing predators. Then in the second phase of the game, the cold phase, they must face both the predators and the Winter Wraiths with the equipment they acquired and the savings they have collected. The game ends when the Winter Wraiths are defeated and the Boilers in the forest are reignited.

Karukinka was designed for the Financial Education Department of the Social Investment and Solidarity Fund (FOSIS) of the Ministry of Social Development of the Government of Chile. Its use was initially implemented in schools in five regions throughout Chile. Within the framework of a campaign to strengthen the value of savings in 14-15 years aged children. The game is widely appreciated by teachers and students. There have also been tournaments at the national level.

Karukinka mean “our land” in Selknam language, one of the indigenous people of Chile.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Great Race: Round the World/Duel+
boardgame.description: This expansion provides greater depth for the game, encouraging campaign play and continental competitions. Plus, it contains an excellent solo mode which takes advantage of this "legacy" to create a deeper challenger for your "Me against the Game" experience.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Great Race: Wild West and Far East

boardgame.name: Visions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The workers on Mandala Station are being driven mad, and the team has been called in to investigate. Before they get to the bottom of things, the scrappers will be pitted against half-crazed pirates, devious smugglers, maddened workers and a dangerous new drug.

Visions is an action horror scenario for Shadows Over Sol. It is designed to run between one and three gaming sessions, and serves either as a prelude to the Jovian Whispers campaign or as a standalone adventure.

boardgame.name: Disney Gargoyles: Awakening
boardgame.description:
In Disney Gargoyles: Awakening, which is named after the TV show, players each represent one of six Gargoyles characters — Goliath, Brooklyn, Lexington, Broadway, Hudson, or NYPD detective Elisa Maza — fight against baddies Xanatos and Demona in one of four scenarios on a three-dimensional cityscape board showing Manhattan as it was depicted in the cartoon. Three of the scenarios are co-operative, while the final one is not:


"Reawakening" — Face off against Xanatos and Demona to save Coldstone's mind.
"Temptation and Magic" — Defeat Demona, who has stolen the Grimorum Arcanorum to enslave innocents.
"Information Warfare" — Collect three stolen data disks on behalf of Xanatos.
"Battle with the Steel Clan" — One player takes control of Xanatos and the Steel Clan, aiming to defeat a hero or destroy the police tower, while the other players try to stop them as the Gargoyles.

boardgame.name: Beat Street
boardgame.description:
Beat Street is the first beat ‘em up with intuitive single touch controls and is a love letter to the 90s beat ‘em up genre!

Evil gangs are terrorizing Toko City and the citizens need your help! Fight your way through hordes of enemies and become the new hero in town.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Taco Bell Party Pack Card Game
boardgame.description: In Taco Bell Party Pack Card Game, players gather various kinds of Taco Bell menu items, including crunchy tacos, bean burritos and Freezes, in an attempt to feed a crew of Taco Bell fans. Each member of a player's crew comes with specific cravings that need to be sated and doing so earns crave chips — tokens that look like tortilla chips and that have a surprise amount of points to reveal at the end of the game. Players can also use "sauce cards" to help snag food items and win.

Title: Taco Bell Party Pack Card Game Publisher: Ravensburger Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Pirates Girls
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Swap tiles to complete the puzzles with pirate girls.

boardgame.name: Rust: The AfterWorld
boardgame.description:
Rust: The Afterworld is a game! We collected the most amazing peculiarities of a role-playing game altogether and put them all into a completely new card game... reaching the ultimate synthesis of both these universes. Something unlike anything you've tried before. And you can carry it in your pocket!

The game is set in a near future, a possible future. A future in which the world has been devastated by a terrible war. And from the ashes of war a dreadful disease spread out, a plague which affects both men and machines... it is called the RUST.

In this rotten, shattered world, humanity has been decimated... and the survivors have gathered into 4 factions, to the four corners of the Earth, fighting each others for survival.

Among the survivors, there are some chosen ones... a few special individuals who seem to be immune to the plague and who soon become heroes for their peoples. We call them: the Masters.

And you, as a player, will be one of them!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Sol Cup
boardgame.description:
An unofficial championship

From the introduction:

The Galen Hypernova Sol System Open Championship, better known as The Sol Cup is an annual RIP Racing League tournament which has been running for over 150 years. The seven-race contest is a staple of the calendar, and generally ranks as one of the most popular and accessible competitions for racers and fans alike. Downtime between races is short, with each race taking place 24 hours after the previous in deference to the ancient Sol ‘calendar week’.

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Chronicles
boardgame.description:
Zombicide: Chronicles is a stand-alone roleplaying game set in the famous setting of the Zombicide board games. Take a deep dive into this rich universe, create your own Survivor from scratch (or use a ready-to-play one!), and prepare yourself for the end of the world.

But this isn’t your everyday nightmare about the Zombie apocalypse. In Zombicide: Chronicles, you show the undead that the living are still trying to fight back, and you got plenty of guns and willpower to prove it!

With quick and easy mechanics, and gameplay that is enhanced by the use of Zombicide board game miniatures and components, you and your friends will soon be facing entire Zombie Hordes, meeting interesting characters, and exploring a huge metropolis with 10 different areas and unlimited opportunities to keep hope alive and the dead truly dead this time.

Now, it’s time to ask yourself, what will your survivor story be?

boardgame.name: Hentai XXX Plus: Jigsaws Vol 1
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Puzzle game with hentai motives.

boardgame.name: Kaiju Rush
boardgame.description:
Ready, aim, and SMASH cities in Kaiju Rush! Select your favorite Kaiju monster and simply tap to bash buildings to bits and pieces. Don't forget to upgrade monsters and improve your distance. Get further to discover more buildings and to unlock more Kaiju monsters.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Hentai XXX Plus: Jigsaws Vol 2
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Puzzle game where you build jigsaw puzzles with hentai images.

boardgame.name: Kobold Conspiracy 1: Counting Kobolds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Four-Hour Season 10 Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

A mysterious stranger by the name of Uman Warf, has sent you a cry for help, promising wealth in return, but no one seems to have ever heard of him before... Is he hiding something or someone...?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Ragdoll Nightmare
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Return to seeing the world through a child's eyes, when fear was real. Little Miss Paren and her father, Dolmark, have been having nightmares. Ever since the kobold ragdoll was given to her five days ago, nightmares and strange happenings around the house have them spooked. What’s worse, getting rid of the doll seemed to do nothing. The nightmares just spread! Their last hope is to return the doll from whence it came, and hope that whatever wants it leaves them alone.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Wayward Beginnings
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster hunter Ko Windcrester has tasked you to help in his mission to stop the hauntings in the town of Easthaven. Investigate the strange events, find the buried secrets both past and present. Part 1 of the Supernatural Series.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 2.

DungeonCraft Seed: Once Bitten, Ice Shy.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Grand Estate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A pair of elven wine merchants never appeared in Easthaven with their monthly shipment of wine after stopping at the historic Carlisle Estate. They are probably just overstaying their welcome at...The Grand Estate

Adv. Seed Title Do You Know the Way to Lonely Wood?

A four-hour Icewind Dale adventure for Level 1-4 characters. Optimized for average party level (APL) 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Icedawn Over Ten Trail
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A caravan carrying essential materials for a divine ritual that aims to help the people of Bryn Shander stave off the brunt of the Rime of the Frostmaiden attempts to make it through the treacherous passes along the Spine of the World.

However, suspicions fall upon the caravan members as some suspect it has been infiltrated by the Cult of Auril itself, threatening the ritual and the brave travelers that try to reach Ten-Towns with crucial supplies.

A Four-Hour Adventure for 1st through 4th-Level Characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Wailing Ice: Delving in the Dale
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The town of Termalaine has been beset by one misfortune or another for the past tenday, ever since the last group of adventurers left town. Find out what they left behind and put a stop to it!

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: A Garden in the North
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A strange flower was picked from a garden in the frozen lands of Icewind Dale. Although beautiful, this flower has brought nothing but bad luck where ever it goes. Can you return the flower to its rightful place before its too late?

A 2 hour adventure for Tier 1 Characters

This adventure starts off in Easthaven, one of the Ten-Towns in Icewind dale and is based on the I’d Like to Make a Return, Please hook from the Dungeoncraft program.

This adventure is intended for Season 10 AL groups.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Cold Diggers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gathered for the reading of the Last Will and Testament of a recently departed mutual friend, the adventurers must work together to locate and reclaim the inheritance that was stolen from them. Set in the town of Easthaven during the events of the Everlasting Rime.

A four hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Dragon Below
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DARE YOU ENTER THE CREEPING NAVE?

In the depths of Valaara's sanctuary, the Order of the Emerald Claw harnesses ancient engines of destruction to wage war on the surface world. Only the Oracle of War can stop them now - if the adventurers can get it to work! Optimized for APL 16, this is the third in a trilogy of adventures, the Engines of War storyline.

boardgame.name: Scare It!: Ogre promo cards
boardgame.description:
These promo cards add a new animal to the game: the Ogre. In order to use it, just replace all the Elephant cards with the Ogre ones (all of them, animal and objective cards).
Now, the Ogre scares the Dog, the Dog scares the Cat, the Cat scares the Mouse and the Mouse scares the Ogre.

boardgame.name: Into Darkness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Times have been especially hard on the goliaths of Wyrmdoom Crag, and losing the few hunters they have left to neogi slavers will certainly spell their doom. You must delve into the ruins of an ancient city buried beneath the Spine of the World. What secrets lay in the deep dark? Do they promise salvation or doom?

Part Seven of the Plague of Ancients Series of Adventures.

A Four-Hour Adventure for 5th through 10th-Level Characters
Optimized for APL 8.

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Shadowfang Keep Dungeon Deck
boardgame.description: Players can form a party of three to take on Lord Godfrey and the cursed denizens of Shadowfang Keep cooperatively. Unlike previous raid decks of World of Warcraft: Trading Card Game, you don't need a pilot for a Dungeon Deck, the deck plays itself by a built-in AI. You can also customize the Dungeon Deck for difficulty and your heroes will level up as you gain experience.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – The Four Horseman
boardgame.description: Four miniatures of the Four Horseman of the Apocalypse for the game and tons of new cards to add gameplay variety.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness

boardgame.name: Irr-elephant
boardgame.description:
Irr-elephant is finally here; the premier elephant stacking wooden game!

First, stack up the elephants higher and higher on progressively more precarious perches. Then, once you've completed your teetering tower, roll the die, and remove an elephant whose color matches the die. But be careful, if the elephants come crashing down, you lose!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Spiral Dice
boardgame.description: Spiral Dice are simple dice that drive complex and unexpected narratives in RPGs. They are hackable, system-agnostic, pleasant to roll, and one set of six dice will serve a whole gaming table. With the Sapio generic game system, which is built to use the dice and draws inspiration from FATE, Powered by the Apocalypse systems, and Genesys, RPG groups will be able to bring their own settings to life. Through the Spiral Dice Hackers' Guide, game designers and game masters will have all the information they need to leverage the storytelling power of Spiral Dice in their own designs.
boardgame.rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)

boardgame.name: Crimes & Capers: Lady Leona's Last Wishes
boardgame.description:
It's 1919 at the Langford Estate. Lady Leona has died and absolutely no one is sad about it. She was forever threatening to write people out of her will. Now that she is finally gone, her closest family and favored servants have gathered for the reading of her will — but Leona always loved two things: puzzles and making life difficult.

Crimes & Capers: Lady Leona's Last Wishes is a co-operative game in which you and a group of friends take on the roles of polished high society folks and hard-working servants who need to collaborate to solve the mystery and find Leona's treasure. No special skills or prior knowledge are required. Read the notes, figure out puzzles, and unlock the answers to find out where Leona hid her fortune!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Sapio System Core Rules
boardgame.description:
The Sapio System is a roleplaying game ruleset that utilizes Spiral Dice. It is a lightweight, flexible framework for telling the stories of one or more characters controlled by players, in a world managed by a game master (GM). The “Spiral” name reflects the mechanics embedded in the dice, which inject complications or drama into scenes as the characters move through the shared imaginative space.

Sapio leverages the dice to create a dynamic story from a few simple elements. Character descriptors are quick to craft and are the primary influence on how likely a character is to succeed at a given task. Actions taken by the characters are not confined to skill lists, so characters are free to “try anything” in response to challenges they may encounter. Finally, Action Sequences provide a cinematic framework for tense group moments like combat or chases, with constantly evolving action aided by the complications from rolling Spiral Dice.

​

The Sapio System draws on many sources of inspiration which will be familiar to veteran roleplaying game players. In its “tag-based” Professions and Qualities, it draws inspiration from FATE and is similar to Barbarians of Lemuria. Its custom dice draw inspiration from FATE and Genesys. Its narrative design is heavily influenced by the “Powered by the Apocalypse” games.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Crimes & Capers: High School Hijinks
boardgame.description:
Welcome to 1998, when Romi's been framed! As the senior leaders of Blair High School, you have gathered the passed notes from today to see whether you can figure out who framed Romi. If you don't figure it out, she will be expelled!

Crimes & Capers: High School Hijinks is a co-operative game in which you and a group of friends take on the roles of 1990s high-school students and work together to solve the mystery. No special skills or prior knowledge are required. Read notes and solve puzzles to unlock Romi's locker, then figure out who framed her!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: NYC&D {GM Guide]
boardgame.description:
It's the weekend before Halloween, 2019, in New York City. Some people are dressed up, and you're attending your own celebration. But something is about to go terribly wrong with reality, and you have a long night ahead of you!

This is a one-shot built to use the Sapio RPG system. It includes tools to collaboratively create the starting conditions and for the GM to flexibly introduce threats.

boardgame.description:

This is a one-shot built to use the Sapio RPG system. It includes tools to collaboratively create the starting conditions and for the GM to flexibly introduce threats.

boardgame.name: Transformers Deck-Building Game
boardgame.description:
Transform and roll out!

The Autobots are brave robot warriors hailing from the planet Cybertron. Their mission? To stop the Decepticons from enacting their evil schemes on Earth.

In Transformers Deck-Building Game, you take on the role of one of the mighty Autobots. Travel and explore the Matrix and transform between your different modes as you gain allies, find relics, and acquire technology to do battle with the Decepticons. But be warned! As your deck grows, more powerful Decepticons will rise up to challenge you.

Transformers Deck-Building Game can be played competitively or as a co-operative experience. This core set will begin your collection with everything needed to play, but the battle is far from over as playable Decepticons are on the way to expand your game.

boardgame.name: 即売会! (Sokubaikai!)
boardgame.description:
即売会! (Sokubaikai!) is a co-operative card game from Japan. It's a two-day spot sale, and the players want to clean up and grab all those bargains. The goal is to clear all their hands of all cards before the game ends. If any player is left holding a card at the end of the game, they all lose.

The game has a deck of 48 cards numbered 1-48. The cards are in sections each with their own theme, 1-9 (Kitakuba), 10-19 (butterflies), 20-29 (eyeglasses), 30-39 (yokai), 40-48 (fanzines).

The deck is shuffled and seven cards are dealt out face-down to each player. Players sort their hand and then choose a hand card, placing it face-down. Once everyone has chosen, they reveal their card, and the lowest card is placed first in the centre (onto an imaginary zero), and then the next card and so on (similar to 6 nimmt!. Cards are played into a pile, and lower cards are hidden and not to be examined later.

Then each player draws a card so their hand is back to seven, and play continues in the same way.

At any point, even at the start, a player can call for a trade, and all players pass a card to the left. Successive trades can be made in the same round, but only six trades are allowed in the whole game. A marker is moved along a track on the rear of the game box to count the trades.

Discussion is allowed in the game, but is limited. Players cannot say or imply a specific numbered card, but can talk in general about their cards. For example, 'I have two 20s', or 'I have zero Kitakuba'. In this way, players can work out which cards would be good to trade or keep in hand.

If a player cannot play a card to the pile legally, the first day of sales ends and the pile is set to one side. Play continues for a second day, starting at zero again. If a player cannot play legally again, day two ends and the players all lose.

If the players succeed in clearing their entire hands before day two ends, they all win.

(Note: this game was published in Japan in 2016, before The Mind in 2018).
user summary

boardgame.name: MAIM! Pick-Up Guide
boardgame.description:
In the days of old, adventurers would go out on epic journeys, fight hordes of foes, and arise victorious with treasure and glory. Now they play maim - a sport where two teams of heroes volley each other with an anti-gravity maimball to score points.

A point is scored when a maim player is killed.

MAIM! is a roleplaying game about playing a dangerous deathsport, in a world full of magic, futuristic technology, and a strange cast of enemies who all think you look like an easy point. It's a fast-paced, bombastic adventure Illuminated by Spencer Campbell's LUMEN system, which empowers players to take on the role of badass heroes.

MAIM! is currently still in the late stages of development, but the full game will include several unique classes and dozens of enemies. For now, there's the MAIM! Pick-Up Guide, a pared-down version of the rules that's perfect for a quick game at the gym.

Happy maiming!
Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: A Doven Investigation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Doven Investigation is an adventure for 5e to take characters from level 1 to 3.

Within the city of Doven a series of bizarre accidents have worried city authorities. They suspect the origin of these accidents come from a necromancer and so seek out a group of adventurers to hire. Their job is to find out what is causing these accidents and put a stop to it.

This job though won't be as easy as it seems. The party will have to make sure to not accuse innocent people, work what the city authorities aren't telling them about these accidents and finally uncover the more infernal origin of what endangers Doven.

This adventure serves as a sandbox mystery adventure presenting the party a variety of ways to uncover what truly is happening in Doven. It is a good way for a parties characters to meet up and explore the city of Doven together as they work out more and more about the city.

boardgame.name: General Store
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It would be a shame if the little store outside the town got raided. Or maybe a lonely druid-owned store got problems with some thieves in the forest entrance. This is a map where the GM and players can enjoy the opportunity to think about inside and outside strategies, with different ways to take cover or ambush enemies.

Those large (30" x 30") battle maps are rendered in JPG images for online players - already a 30" x 30" with 70 DPI for Roll20 platform.

It comes with four options:

1) Daylight battle map with grid.
2) Daylight battle map without grid.
3) Night time battle map with grid.
4) Night time battle map without grid.

boardgame.name: Pier
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever thought about letting your friends fight in a pier, whit multiple possibilities of combat in four different levels? Shallow and deep water, pier level and the top of the houses! This map allows you and your players to fight in different kinds of ground - easy and difficult terrain -, take cover from the houses and boxes, and also use the mist all around the map to any creative solutions or situations you may want.

Those large (30" x 30") battle maps are rendered in JPG images for online players - already a 30" x 30" with 70 DPI for Roll20 platform.

It comes with four options:

1) Daylight battle map with grid.
2) Daylight battle map without grid.
3) Night time battle map with grid.
4) Night time battle map without grid.

boardgame.name: City Hall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Everybody loves a town fight!

Maybe some orcs that invaded the town and want to take down the City Hall? Maybe some thieves got caught and now they want to fight so they can runaway?

So what about a battle next to the city center, right in front some important buildings and next to the chaos from some little shops lying around?

This is a map where you and your players can take cover from the houses or use their ceilings to help gain advantage against your foes! Those large (30" x 30") battle maps are rendered in JPG images for online players - already a 30" x 30" with 70 DPI for Roll20 platform.

It comes with four options:

1) Daylight battle map with grid
2) Daylight battle map without grid
3) Night time battle map with grid (lights on / lights off)
4) Night time battle map without grid (lights on / lights off)

boardgame.name: Scion Live-Action
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Scion Live-Action is a live-action roleplaying game (LARP for short) that concerns the creatures and persons of myth and legend and how they interact with the World, a place where all myths are real and all stories have weight.

Fate is its own force in the World, and the characters in this book are feeling its first touches upon their souls. Whether mundane or supernatural, Scion Live-Action is the story of people in a liminal space where myth begins to be real and immediate.

Scion Live-Action features:

A completely new system designed from the ground up for live-action roleplaying.
A new take on the World focused on LARP.
Character creation rules for heroic Scions, pre-Visitation Scions, and Denizens of the World.
Storyguiding advice for running Scion Live-Action.

boardgame.name: Ominous Visions
boardgame.description:
From the description:

"It’s raining and has for days. Driven by rumours of witches covens, demons and devils amongst the trees, haunted fens and the restless undead, a travellers coach approaches. It seeks answers to the visions."

A 2 page A3 PDF containing 60 short descriptions of dark, twisted and mysterious scenes. A great tool for GM's to spark some inspiration, present to their players as omens, memories or predictions, or build whole adventures around with a bit of imagination. To this end they are deliberately ambiguous but hint at dark locations, dangerous fauna and flora and the grim occupants of an imagined landscape.
